0.title: Chahar is a bit lower in the pecking order in T20Is: Saba Karim
0.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim said that he feels that seamer Deepak Chahar is a "bit lower" in the pecking order in T20Is even when "fully fit". "You have...Jasprit Bumrah and the experience of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and also youngsters like Avesh Khan and Arshdeep Singh. Chahar has improved...but he has been expensive at the death," Karim said.

1.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia to travel to Gujarat next week for poll campaign
1.article_body: Amidst the CBI case against Delhi's excise policy irregularities, CM Arvind Kejriwal said he and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia will visit Gujarat next week. Kejriwal said they will travel with the message that if voted to power, Gujarat will get free and quality education as well as healthcare services. Assembly elections in Gujarat are due in the next few months.

2.title: TMC leader stabbed to death in West Bengal; 4 detained
2.article_body: A Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader named Alam was stabbed to death in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Saturday morning. Police said they have detained four people in connection with the murder. As per Times Now, Alam was allegedly shot at before being stabbed multiple times in Basanti town. The motive for the attack is yet to be ascertained.

3.title: 2 women electrocuted while cutting grass in a field in UP's Etah
3.article_body: Two women were electrocuted to death while cutting grass in a field in Chhitauni village in UP's Etah district. The deceased, Chandravati (55) and Usha Devi (60), died when a high-tension wire broke and fell on them, police said. Notably, the villagers demanded that the district administration and the electricity department provide financial aid to the families of the deceased.

4.title: Terror threat received by Mumbai Police should be taken seriously: Ajit Pawar
4.article_body: After Mumbai Police's traffic wing received several text messages on its helpline number threatening a "26/11-like" attack, NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Saturday said these threats should be taken seriously. "The state government should take this threat seriously and our police are very able in such situations," Pawar said. "But central agencies should also look into the matter," Pawar added.

5.title: We named her 'Antim' so we don't get another daughter: U-20 world champ wrestler's mother
5.article_body: Krishna Kumari, the mother of Antim Panghal who became the first-ever Indian woman to bag gold at Under-20 Wrestling World Championships, revealed how they named her daughter. She said, "We named our daughter Antim so...we don’t get another daughter as we got four daughters." "Antim has become Pehli (first) in the wrestling world today," she added about her win.

6.title: Wrestler Antim creates history, becomes 1st Indian woman to win gold at U-20 World C'ships
6.article_body: Wrestler Antim Panghal has created history by becoming the first Indian woman to win a gold medal at the Under-20 Wrestling World Championships. The 17-year-old defeated Kazakhstan's Altyn Shagayeva 8-0 in the final of the 53-kg category to achieve the feat. Antim had also won gold medal at the Asian Junior Championships earlier this year.

7.title: 13 potential regions for landing the next humans on Moon identified by NASA
7.article_body: NASA announced 13 potential landing sites for its upcoming Artemis III mission to return humans to the Moon for first time since Apollo. Each of these regions is located within six degrees of latitude of lunar South Pole. The regions contain sites that provide continuous access to sunlight throughout a 6.5-day period- the planned duration of Artemis III surface mission.

8.title: Extremely painful: Himachal CM over heavy losses due to torrential rains
8.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Saturday expressed concerns over heavy losses to lives and properties as torrential rains battered the state. "The incidents of untimely death of some people due to heavy rains across the state are extremely painful," Thakur said. He directed the district administrations to ensure relief, rescue and rehabilitation works in the affected areas.

9.title: No new cars, greet everyone with namaste, adab: Bihar Dy CM to ministers
9.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has issued a series of dos and don'ts to the newly-elected ministerial colleagues of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD). "Ministers...will not buy any new cars for themselves in the department," his order stated. Yadav also requested the ministers to be courteous towards everyone and promote the tradition of salutation with 'namaste' and 'adab'.

10.title: Zimbabwe bowler's relative asks Chahar 'Can I touch you?' before taking pic, video viral
10.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a relative of a Zimbabwe cricketer asking India cricketer Deepak Chahar, "Can I touch you?" before taking a picture with him. In the video, the woman can be seen laughing once Chahar agrees. "He is very humble...I liked it how accommodating he is," the woman later said.

11.title: I have done this on my own: Kartik on completing 11 years in B'wood
11.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, speaking about completing 11 years in the film industry, said, "I take pride in the fact that I've done this on my own and with...help of people who put their trust in my capabilities without knowing me." "They went for the craft instead of lineage," he added. Kartik will next be seen in films like 'Freddy' and 'Shehzada'.

12.title: Let's turn this sh*t back: Kyrgios on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open
12.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of himself on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open 2022 and wrote, "Young Kygs (Kyrgios) in NY (New York). Let's turn this sh*t back." The 27-year-old Australian has never reached beyond the third round of the US Open in eight attempts so far.

13.title: Rajasthan BJP takes out protest march over deteriorating law & order
13.article_body: The BJP took out a protest march in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Saturday against the state government over its failure to maintain law and order. "The law and order situation in Rajasthan has completely deteriorated to which CM Ashok Gehlot has no answer," Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia said. Under his rule, Rajasthan has become a capital of crime, Poonia added.

14.title: RPF rescues 67 live turtles from train in Bihar's Kishanganj
14.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) on Saturday rescued 67 live turtles from seven unclaimed bags in a coach of Ajmer-Kishanganj Garib Nawaz Express at Bihar's Kishanganj station. "No arrests have been made so far. RPF has informed officials of the district forest department about the recovery of these turtles," RPF Inspector said. Authorities suspect the turtles were poached from Ajmer.

15.title: Train hits 3 walking with earphones in separate incidents in UP; all dead
15.article_body: Three people, walking on railway tracks with their earphones plugged in, died after being hit by different trains in Uttar Pradesh. While the Howrah-Lal Kuan Express mowed Krishna (20) and Monu (18) at railway tracks near Bhadohi railway station, Pankaj (30) was hit by a passenger train on Varanasi-Allahabad railway line. They couldn't hear the train approaching due to earphones.

16.title: A proud moment: Anil as int'l film critic predicts Oscar nomination for RRR
16.article_body: Anil Kapoor tweeted a video of international film critic Clayton Davis praising Rajamouli's 'RRR' and predicting its place in the Oscars nominations. Clayton, who often makes predictions about Oscars and Emmys, called 'RRR' "a monument to action cinema" and said it reminded him of George Miller's 'Mad Max: Fury Road'. Anil wrote, "A proud moment, looking forward to Oscar nomination."

17.title: Indonesia confirms first monkeypox case in foreign returnee
17.article_body: Indonesia reported its first confirmed case of monkeypox in a 27-year-old male on Saturday. The Indonesian national tested positive in capital Jakarta late on Friday, a health ministry spokesperson said. According to the ministry, the man had returned from an unidentified country with documented cases. The patient is doing "well" and showing only mild symptoms, the ministry added.

18.title: It's a sad thing: Dean Elgar on SA being alloted 28 Tests from 2023 to 2027
18.article_body: After South Africa were allotted 28 Test matches in the 2023-27 Future Tours Programme cycle, skipper Dean Elgar said that it's a "sad thing". "I guess we could be playing more...I can't say too much about that because I might get into trouble," Elgar said. South Africa were at the sixth spot while England topped the list with 43 Tests.

19.title: Liquor trader paid ₹1 crore to Manish Sisodia's aide: CBI in FIR
19.article_body: A liquor trader paid ₹1 crore to a company managed by Dinesh Arora, an associate of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, the CBI said in its FIR in the excise policy case. Radha Industries received ₹1 crore from Sameer Mahendru of Indospirits, the agency alleged. Arora and others were allegedly involved in managing undue pecuniary advantage collected from liquor licensees.

20.title: 16 dead, 8 missing after flash floods, landslides in Himachal Pradesh
20.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and eight others were reported missing in incidents of landslide, flash flood and cloudburst triggered by heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh in the past 24 hours, a senior official said on Saturday. State Disaster Management Department Director Sudesh Kumar Mokhta added that the maximum damage has been reported in Mandi, Kangra and Chamba districts.

21.title: 4 killed, several injured amid heavy rainfall in U'khand; 10 missing
21.article_body: Four people died and several others sustained injuries due to rain-related incidents in Uttarakhand as torrential rain hit parts of the state, forcing people to leave their damaged and flooded houses, officials said on Saturday. Ten people have been reported missing so far. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami inspected the affected areas and instructed officials to ensure a speedy rescue operation.

22.title: Condom pack used to dress woman's head injury at health centre in MP, pic surfaces
22.article_body: A woman's head injury was dressed using a condom pack along with cotton at a health care clinic in Madhya Pradesh. It was discovered when a doctor at a district hospital began to change the dressing of her injury. The dresser from the Porsa Community Health Centre has been suspended by the state health department, officials said.

23.title: 24.5 lakh tickets sold for this year's World Cup in Qatar: FIFA
23.article_body: Around 24.5 lakh tickets for this year's World Cup in Qatar have been sold until now, FIFA said. Football's global governing body informed that the biggest number of allocated tickets were for group stage matches like Cameroon vs Brazil. "Fans living in Qatar, Saudi Arabia, the United States, Mexico, the United Arab Emirates, England, Argentina, Brazil...led the way," FIFA added.

24.title: CWG gold added fresh boost to Sen's confidence: Father ahead of World C'ships
24.article_body: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen's father DK Sen said his son's gold medal at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games and the bronze medal at the World Championships 2021 have added a fresh boost to his confidence ahead of World Championships 2022. "He will be a great medal contender in Tokyo, this time, as well," he added.

25.title: Delhi court acquits CM Kejriwal, Sisodia in 2013 defamation case
25.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday acquitted CM Arvind Kejriwal, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and former AAP leader Yogendra Yadav in a criminal defamation case filed by lawyer Surender Sharma. Sharma had claimed that his candidature from AAP was cancelled in 2013 Assembly elections at the last moment. All three persons were present in the court when the order was pronounced.

26.title: Montenegro govt collapses over pact with Serbian Orthodox Church
26.article_body: Montenegro's coalition government collapsed on Saturday after the country's parliament passed a motion of no confidence against the cabinet of PM Dritan Abazovic. The no-confidence motion was proposed by 36 deputies (members) of the parliament to protest the recent signing of an agreement regulating the position of the Serbian Orthodox Church in Montenegro.

27.title: Those who oppose CAA, don’t understand it: MoS Ajay Kumar Mishra
27.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Kumar Mishra reacted to people's demand for the exemption of the Citizenship Amendment Act and said people opposing CAA are the ones who don't understand it. "CAA is a 1955 law when the then government made...law on citizenship. We've only amended it and [it's]...not applicable to...citizen of the country," he said.

28.title: Heavy security deployed around Hyd venue hosting Munawar Faruqui
28.article_body: Heavy security was deployed around Hyderabad's Shilpakala Vedika auditorium ahead of stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui's performance on Saturday. BJP members are planning to hold a protest against Faruqui, ANI reported. BJP MLA Raja Singh was detained on Friday for reportedly trying to burn down the auditorium. Earlier, the MLA threatened to beat Faruqui for his alleged comments on Lord Ram.

29.title: India win 14th straight ODI vs Zimbabwe, record their 10th series win of 2022
29.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by five wickets in the second ODI in Harare to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. India have now won 14 ODIs in a row against Zimbabwe. Further, India have now won 10 series across formats in international cricket in 2022. The third Zimbabwe-India ODI will take place on Monday.

30.title: World no. 1 Medvedev enters 2nd consecutive semi-final at Cincinnati Open
30.article_body: World number one Daniil Medvedev and fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas entered the semi-finals at the Cincinnati Open after defeating Americans Taylor Fritz and John Isner on Friday. Medvedev beat Taylor Fritz 7-6(7-1), 6-3, while Tsitsipas defeated John Isner 7-6(7-5), 5-7, 6-3. Medvedev, who reached his second straight semi-final in Cincinnati, will face Tsitsipas on Saturday.

31.title: Telangana BJP Prez calls for boycott of Munawar Faruqui's Hyd show
31.article_body: Telangana BJP President Bandi Sanjay Kumar called for the boycott of comedian Munawar Faruqui's show to be held in Hyderabad on Saturday. "As if the comedy circus of TRS govt run by a bunch of clowns...isn't enough, now they're bringing Munawar Faruqui," tweeted Kumar. He alleged that Faruqui had demeaned Lord Ram and Goddess Sita in the name of comedy.

32.title: Army team treks 213 km of unexplored Ladakh terrain in 12 days
32.article_body: The Indian Army's 14-member 'Snow Leopard Brigade' completed a trek in Ladakh covering 213 km of unexplored terrain in 12 days. "Trekking expedition from Rumtse to Nyoma through tough terrain with heights ranging from 14,000 feet to 18,000 feet," tweeted Indian Army's Northern Command. In July, an 11-member team trekked 162 km of rugged terrain in Himachal Pradesh.

33.title: Want to discuss Delhi's excise policy in monsoon session: BJP
33.article_body: Leader of Opposition in the Delhi Assembly, Ramvir Singh Bidhuri, on Saturday alleged the CM Arvind Kejriwal-led government had given permission to open liquor vends in non-conforming areas. He demanded the monsoon session be called to discuss the city's excise policy. "While the liquor sales have gone up...the government's revenue from it hasn't. Why so?" he further asked.

34.title: It's my fault, need to understand what people want: Akshay on films' failure
34.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about his recent films not working at the box office, said, "If my films aren't working, it's my fault." "I have to make the changes, I have to understand what the audience wants," Akshay said, adding, "I want to make changes, I want to dismantle my way of working. Nobody else is to be blamed but me."

35.title: Harnaaz teaches B'wood dance steps to comedian Trevor Noah, shares video
35.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu recently appeared on 'The Daily Show with Trevor Noah' and shared a video from the sets on her Instagram handle. In the video, Harnaaz could be seen teaching some Bollywood dance steps to the show's host and comedian Trevor Noah. "It was such a pleasure to share the stage with one and only @trevornoah," she wrote.

36.title: 25 injured after bus rams into truck in UP's Etah
36.article_body: Twenty-five people were injured after a roadways bus rammed into a stationary truck near Keelramau village in UP's Etah district. All 25 injured people were passengers inside the bus which was travelling from Farrukhabad to Delhi. Notably, the injured have been admitted to the Etah Medical College hospital. According to the passengers, the driver was driving at high speed.

37.title: Pune selected for C40 Cities Bloomberg Philanthropies Awards
37.article_body: Pune city has been picked as a finalist in the 2022 C40 Cities Bloomberg Philanthropies Awards in the “United to clean the air we breathe” category. Pune has been selected in recognition of the electrification of public transport buses in the Pune Metropolitan Area. Pune’s public transport system will have 650 electric buses by the end of 2022, authorities said.

38.title: Bengaluru woman's plan to get husband killed fails; lover dies by suicide
38.article_body: A Bengaluru woman's plan to get her husband killed failed after the contract killers she and her boyfriend had hired sent them a photo that seemingly confirmed the murder. Fearing arrest, Himavanth, Anupallavi's lover, died by suicide while Anupallavi's husband, Naveen, surprisingly returned after two weeks and said that he had befriended the contract killers during his kidnapping, police said.

39.title: 5 arrested for stealing laptops worth ₹6.5 lakh in Noida
39.article_body: A group of five men wanted in connection with multiple theft cases in Noida was arrested for allegedly stealing more than 22 laptops worth ₹6.5 lakh, Noida Police said on Friday. According to police, the accused broke into the premises of two IT companies in Noida's Sector 63 during the early hours of July 30 and stole 27 laptops.

40.title: 40-yr-old Hyderabad man ends life over harassment from loan agents
40.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Ravinder Yadav, allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad after being harassed over repayment of money he borrowed through online applications. He was employed in a private company and lived with his wife and two children. "In their complaint, relatives alleged Yadav...had obtained loans...and failed to repay it, was being threatened by unknown persons over phone," police said.

41.title: I-T Dept raids J'khand hotel in search of Partha Chatterjee's aide
41.article_body: The Income Tax Department conducted a raid at a hotel in Jharkhand's Hazaribag district in search of an alleged close aide of West Bengal's ex-minister Partha Chatterjee. The department had received input from the Enforcement Directorate that the person was in Jharkhand's Bhandara Park to allegedly hide unaccounted money. He reportedly left the hotel hours before the I-T team arrived.

42.title: Mediation important tool for desperately congested courts: SC judge
42.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said mediation is an important tool in reducing pendency in the "extremely burdened" and "desperately congested" courts of India. The judge quoted data which said lower courts have pendency of 4.1 crore cases, while high courts have about 59 lakh cases. He said the pandemic has worsened the already alarming pendency in the system.

43.title: BJP leader said one must give ₹2,500 cr for K'taka CM post: Cong MLC
43.article_body: As per a report, Congress MLC BK Hariprasad has alleged that there are too many aspirants for the post of Karnataka Chief Minister and there is "big money" involved. "According to a [senior BJP] leader, one should cough up ₹ 2,500 crore," Hariprasad added. BJP leader Prabhu Chavan said, "This is just a lie. CM's seat is not for sale."

44.title: Don't let older people touch your feet: Tejashwi to RJD ministers
44.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav asked all the RJD ministers not to purchase new vehicles for themselves and not to let those older than them touch their feet. He also encouraged the ministers to exchange pens or books instead of gifting bouquets. "Will promote the tradition of...namaste and adaab with folded hands for greetings," he said.

45.title: 16 arrested in connection with death threat to Cong leader Siddaramaiah
45.article_body: Police on Saturday said 16 persons were arrested in connection with a death threat received by Congress leader Siddaramaiah. "Nine people have been arrested in Kushalnagar and seven in Madikeri, all of whom will be produced before the magistrate court," Kodagu SP said. This comes after Siddaramaiah claimed that he received death threats over his remarks on Veer Savarkar.

46.title: Ishan Kishan mistakenly hits Axar Patel with ball, Axar's angry reaction goes viral
46.article_body: During the second ODI against Zimbabwe, India's Ishan Kishan mistakenly hit Axar Patel with the ball while throwing it back from the deep. Axar covered his head with both his hands while in a crouched position, however, the ball bumped straight into him. Axar was then seen staring at Ishan while seeming to be angry. Ishan then apologised to Axar.

47.title: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi ruled out of Asia Cup
47.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi has been ruled out of the Asia Cup due to an injury to the right knee ligament. The 22-year-old has been advised rest for four to six weeks by the medical team. He had sustained the injury while fielding during the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle last month.

48.title: Nagaland's NDPP, BJP dismiss merger speculation after 2023 polls
48.article_body: Ruling alliance partners in Nagaland, Nationalist Democratic Progressive Party (NDPP) and BJP, have dismissed speculation that the two will merge after the 2023 Assembly elections. "BJP is a national party...while NDPP is a regional entity with its own principles. There is neither any agenda nor have we held any discussion over merger," NDPP leader Neiba Kronu said on Friday.

49.title: Man held for cheating jewellers of ₹4.2 cr in Mumbai, cash seized
49.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 65-year-old man, Srikumar Shankara Pillai, for allegedly cheating jewellers to the tune of ₹4.22 crore by starting a chain of bogus jewellery stores, an official said on Friday. After the key of a BMW was found in his Dombivli residence, police located the car and found ₹2.09 crore in it, the official added.

50.title: 44,900 Russian soldiers killed, 1,907 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
50.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed around 44,900 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Around 1,907 Russian tanks and more than 430 aircraft, including 197 helicopters, have also been destroyed, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. The ministry further estimated that its forces have destroyed 4,212 armoured personnel carriers and 266 multiple launch rocket systems.

51.title: Stand-up comic Munawar Faruqui's show cancelled in Bengaluru
51.article_body: Stand-up comic Munawar Faruqui's show 'Dongri to Nowhere' was cancelled at the last minute on Friday in Bengaluru as the organisers didn't seek permission, police said. It's the second time that Faruqui's show has been cancelled in Bengaluru since November 2021. The cancellation came after a Hindutva outfit reportedly petitioned police, alleging Faruqui had hurt Hindu sentiments in his shows.

52.title: New Zealand floods reminder to protect environment: Prince William
52.article_body: UK's Prince William said that the floods which have ravaged New Zealand are a reminder of the need to "protect the environment". Hundreds of people have been forced to evacuate their homes due to heavy rains and flooding this week. The Mayor of Nelson, which is New Zealand's worst-affected city, said that it could "take years, not months" to recover.

53.title: B'wood created these 'monsters': Hansal after KRK's tweet on Dobaaraa
53.article_body: Reacting to a tweet by actor Kamaal R Khan where he trolled the box office collection of 'Dobaaraa', filmmaker Hansal Mehta termed him a "monster" created by Bollywood. Hansal added Bollywood's getting kicked in the back, having "sucked up to" and "paid" such monsters. "'Dobaaraa'...[ran] with houseful occupancy for entire day...and...collected the huge amount [of] ₹8 lakhs," KRK had tweeted.

54.title: Uttarakhand CM Dhami inspects areas affected by cloudburst in Dehradun
54.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami visited the areas affected by cloudburst in Dehradun. He instructed the State Disaster Management Department and other administrative officials to be on high alert amid incessant rainfall. He also ordered officers to make alternate arrangements for smooth movement of traffic and to provide immediate relief to the people affected by excessive rains.

55.title: Delhi records over 15 swine flu cases in 2 weeks
55.article_body: More than 15 cases of swine flu (H1N1) have been reported in Delhi in the past two weeks, Delhi government heath officials said on Friday. According to doctors and health experts, the number of swine flu cases might be higher as the symptoms of the infection are similar to COVID-19 and symptomatic patients are not getting tested for swine flu.

56.title: Karnataka's Youth Cong to send eggs to all BJP ministers in protest
56.article_body: After eggs were thrown at former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah's convoy in Kodagu, the state's Youth Congress head Mohammed Haris Nalapad said, "As a mark of protest, we decided to send eggs to all BJP ministers in the state." He added that the BJP is "just trying to disturb the harmony in the state by creating communal tensions".

57.title: 17-yr-old girl raped by maternal uncle in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba
57.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her maternal uncle in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba district, police said on Saturday. The incident reportedly occurred when the victim had gone to visit her maternal grandparents to celebrate Raksha Bandhan. According to Khanna police station SHO, Radheshyam Verma, the accused also threatened to kill the girl if she informed anyone about the incident.

58.title: Richa Chadha got ₹2 lakh, Huma Qureshi got ₹75,000 for Gangs of Wasseypur: Anurag
58.article_body: Anurag Kashyap revealed he hasn't made a sequel to 'Gangs of Wasseypur' as it's considered a loss-making film by its distributors. He added he feels the cast didn't get paid enough money. "Richa Chadha got ₹2 lakh, Huma Qureshi got ₹75,000...You got a good movie in less money, but when it made money...you should pay people for it," Anurag stated.

59.title: AAP govt is 'revdi' & 'bevdi sarkar': Union Minister Anurag Thakur
59.article_body: After CBI conducted a raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence in connection with the excise policy case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that the AAP government is both "revdi" (freebies) and "bevdi sarkar" (drunk government). He also questioned, "Manish Ji, if your liquor policy was right, [then] why did you take it back?"

60.title: All CBI officers were great, behaved with my family very nicely: Manish
60.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that all CBI officers were "great people". "They behaved with my family very nicely. They had to obey orders from high command, but I would like to thank them to have behaved so nicely," Sisodia added. He had earlier said CBI had seized his computer and phone.

61.title: I get mistaken for Priyanka Chopra all the time: She-Hulk's Jameela Jamil
61.article_body: Jameela Jamil, who currently stars in 'She-Hulk: Attorney at Law', said that people mistake her for Priyanka Chopra all the time and called it the 'honour of her life'. Last year, a Twitter user confused Jameela with Priyanka and tweeted, "Did Nick Jonas and Jameela get divorced?" Jameela had responded, "A different Indian woman who doesn't look anything like me."

62.title: Met Police Commissioner for protection, he said 'You don't need it': Kashyap
62.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, who directed 'Black Friday', said he'd met ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner Rakesh Maria for requesting protection after the film's release. "He said, 'You don't need it. [The] underworld loves you'," added Kashyap. Kashyap stated he was also forced to attend a gangster's Christmas party after the release of 'Satya'. "They made me sit on a throne," he said.

63.title: Man throws 11-month-old son into canal due to financial trouble in Raj
63.article_body: A man, facing financial trouble, allegedly threw his 11-month-old son into a canal in Rajasthan's Jalore, police said. He told his wife that he had dropped him off at his father's place, police added. The accused, a Gujarat resident, came to Jalore with his wife and son and asked her to wait at a place near the canal, police stated.

64.title: Inspired by web series, Surat teen buys revolver to impress others; arrested
64.article_body: A 14-year-old boy was sent to a juvenile home after police caught him with a country-made revolver in Gujarat's Surat. The minor told police that watching armed heroes in crime web series inspired him to procure a weapon. So, he bought the revolver during his visit to Uttar Pradesh for ₹6,000 and used it to impress and scare others.

65.title: Sonam Kapoor, Anand Ahuja blessed with a baby boy
65.article_body: Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja were blessed with a baby boy on Saturday. Neetu Kapoor, who co-starred with Sonam's father Anil Kapoor in 'Jugjugg Jeeyo', shared a screenshot of their statement. It read, "On 20.08.2022, we welcomed our...baby boy with bowed heads and open hearts. Thank you to...the doctors, nurses, friends and family who have supported us on this journey."

66.title: Karthik is a different type of power player: Mike Hesson
66.article_body: RCB's director of cricket operations Mike Hesson said that Indian batter Dinesh Karthik is a "different type of power player". "Karthik came from the wilderness...[Getting] an Indian finisher was difficult," Hesson said. He added, "There are very few players who are like AB de Villiers...But we watched him (Karthik) closely from overs 15-20 and he did well in those overs."

67.title: I am on BJP's radar for speaking out truth: Siddaramaiah
67.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah criticised BJP and said that he's on BJP's radar for speaking out the truth. "Those who killed Gandhiji, will they spare me? I tell the truth that's why BJP and RSS people are angry with me. Nathuram Godse killed Gandhiji, it is sad that they worship his portrait," said Siddaramaiah.

68.title: 25-yr-old hammers landlord to death in Delhi, takes selfie, video with body
68.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly hammering his landlord to death in Delhi. The landlord and the accused had an argument after the latter came home drunk. "After [the landlord] fell asleep, the accused hit him on the head with a hammer. He also took a selfie with the body and took a video of it," police said.

69.title: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad civic body to recruit 386 permanent staffers
69.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has decided to recruit 386 permanent staffers in different departments, officials said. The last date to submit applications for vacancies of permanent staff is September 8, officials added. This comes after the Maharashtra government lifted the ban on recruitment a couple of months ago. "The ban was in force for nearly seven years," officials stated.

70.title: 500 gm of cocaine worth ₹5 cr seized from woman passenger at Mumbai airport
70.article_body: The Customs department recovered 500 grams of cocaine worth ₹5 crore from a woman passenger who arrived at the Mumbai International Airport from Ethiopia, after which she was arrested, officials said. The Customs department in a tweet said that the woman, Bintu Janneh, had arrived from Addis Ababa on Friday, adding that the drug was found concealed in her purse.

71.title: Signed a film & read in paper that somebody else got it, felt terrible: Adah
71.article_body: Actress Adah Sharma recalled her "disappointing" days in the industry and said, "I'd days when I signed a contract for...film and then I read in [a] paper that somebody else had gotten [it]." "I was like how? I felt terrible," she added. "That time it feels like the end of the world...But...you got to be okay with rejections," said Adah.

72.title: US announces new $775 million weapons package for Ukraine
72.article_body: The US has announced a new $775 million weapons package for Ukraine. "President [Joe] Biden has been clear that we'll continue to support...people of Ukraine in defending their country from Russia's aggression for as long as it takes," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said, adding the new package brings the administration's total security assistance to Ukraine to approximately $10.6 billion.

73.title: 4 dams that supply water to Pune city reach full capacity
73.article_body: The four dams that supply water to Pune city have reached full capacity, officials said. On Friday, the Khadakwasla dam released 15,000 cusecs of water, Warasgaon spillway released 3,552 cusecs, Panshet spillway released 1,954 cusecs and Temghar dam released 100 cusecs of water. The total capacity of the four dams is 29.15 thousand million cubic feet.

74.title: If a judge clears 50 cases, 100 more filed: Rijiju on pending cases
74.article_body: With nearly five crore cases pending in courts, Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that if a judge clears 50 cases, 100 new litigations are filed. This is because people are now aware and approach courts to settle disputes, he added. Rijiju also felt that the situation shouldn't be compared with other countries as "we have a different set of problems".

75.title: Hyderabad Mayor distributes fruits to patients in MNJ Cancer Hospital
75.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal on Friday distributed fruits to patients in MNJ Cancer Hospital as a part of 'Swatantra Bharata Vajrotsavam' from August 8 to 22. She also inspected every ward in the hospital. Speaking on the occasion, Gadwal said the state government had constructed night shelters in seven major hospitals for attenders of 862 patients coming from other places.

76.title: Challan for using pressure horns, modified silencers: Delhi Traffic Police
76.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter to announce that it has begun penalising drivers who put pressure horns and modified silencers in their vehicles starting Saturday. "Challans will be issued to those found creating noise pollution by violating the norms," an official said. Welcoming the move, Delhites also called for action against modified headlights and high beam usage.

77.title: PCMC to soon have parking management system
77.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) is planning to have a parking management system in the city soon. "A holistic approach is needed to resolve the parking issues in the city with a focus on reducing the number of vehicles on the street," an official said. "Also, the focus will be on shifting on-street parking to off-street," he added.

78.title: Pak EC issues notice to Imran Khan over 'contemptuous remarks'
78.article_body: The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) on Friday summoned ex-PM Imran Khan for allegedly making "contemptuous" remarks against the poll body. He has been ordered to appear before ECP on August 30. Last month, Imran Khan had urged Chief Election Commissioner Sikandar Raja to resign, stating that his party won the Punjab by-polls despite Raja's attempts to influence the results.

79.title: Spelling of Manish Sisodia's name is now 'MONEY SHH': Anurag Thakur
79.article_body: Following a CBI raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence in connection with the excise policy case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said, "Manish Sisodia might have now changed...spelling of his name too. Now it's - MONEY SHH." He added, "[Sisodia] makes money and maintains silence." He also claimed that AAP was trying to "hide" the excise scam.

80.title: Kiran would try to imitate Dhoni's 2011 WC-winning six everyday: Coach
80.article_body: Talking about Kiran Navgire who recently received her maiden call-up to India's T20I squad for the tour of England, her coach Gulzar Sheikh said she's a "big fan" of MS Dhoni. "Everyday at the nets, she'd try to imitate that 2011 World Cup-winning six," he added. Kiran is the only Indian to score over 150 runs in a T20 match.

81.title: Ginger garlic paste worth ₹5 lakh seized in Hyd; 2 held over adulteration
81.article_body: Two men were arrested in Hyderabad on Friday for allegedly manufacturing adulterated ginger garlic paste. The accused, identified as Mohammed Zaffar Alam and Somnath Chetty, were arrested by Commissioner's Task Force and the central zonal team. Officials seized 650 kg of ginger garlic paste worth ₹5 lakh from them. The accused were detained at Begum Bazar Police Station.

82.title: Bureaucratic reshuffle in Delhi govt, 12 IAS officers transferred
82.article_body: In a bureaucratic reshuffle, 12 IAS officers were transferred within Delhi government. Special Secretary, health and family welfare, Udit Prakash Rai, has been transferred to administrative reforms department as its Special Secretary. IAS Jitendra Narain has been made Chairman and Managing Director of Delhi Finance Corporation and IAS officer Vivek Pandey has been appointed as Secretary (IT).

83.title: 13-yr-old boy dies hours after eating biryani from Hyd restaurant
83.article_body: A 13-year-old boy reportedly died last week, hours after consuming biryani from a restaurant located in Hyderabad's Lakdikapul. His father and sister, who had also consumed the restaurant's biryani for dinner, fell sick and were shifted to a hospital. The family members claimed they ate only biryani the night before the boy died. Police have sent biryani's sample for examination.

84.title: Hard for SA, Aus to not make it: Watson on potential finalists for WTC
84.article_body: Sharing his opinion on potential finalists for the ongoing edition of World Test Championship (WTC), ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said, "It'll...hard for South Africa and Australia to not make it." "You can never discount India and Pakistan...They've got...many match winners," added Watson. "I'd be very surprised if they don't come knocking on the door leading into the final," he stated.

85.title: Twitter tests labelling accounts linked with verified phone numbers: Report
85.article_body: Twitter is testing a label for accounts that are linked with verified phone numbers, according to an image shared by engineer Jane Manchun Wong. As per Twitter's current policy, people can have the same phone number associated with up to 10 Twitter accounts. Further, verified accounts are required to have a verified phone number or email address attached to them.

86.title: Feeling of being called Test cricketer is different: Chahal on Test ambition
86.article_body: Talking about the thought of playing Test cricket for India, spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said the feeling of being called a Test cricketer is completely different. "In my last 10 first-class games I have fifty wickets," he added. The 32-year-old, who made his India debut in June 2016, hasn't made his Test debut so far.

87.title: Lancet warns about 'tomato flu' virus in India that leaves children with red blisters
87.article_body: The Lancet journal has warned about 'tomato flu' virus that has affected children in parts of India. The infection has been named 'tomato flu' because of the red, painful blisters that appear on a patient's body and gradually enlarge to the size of a tomato. It said that the virus is "very contagious" but is considered non-life-threatening.

88.title: 5 killed in wall collapse incidents amid heavy rain in Odisha
88.article_body: Five people, including four children, died and five others were injured in separate wall collapse incidents amid heavy rainfall across Odisha, officials said on Saturday. Two children died and their parents suffered injuries after the mud wall of their house collapsed in Mayurbhanj district. Similarly, a four-year-old girl died in Balasore, whereas a nine-year-old boy died in Koraput district.

89.title: 9-yr-old abducted, raped & killed by villager in Ghaziabad; arrested
89.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and murdering a nine-year-old girl in Ghaziabad's Modinagar. The accused reportedly abducted the victim and her six-year-old cousin on his bicycle on the pretext of buying them ice cream. He left the younger girl behind and went into a dense isolated spot with the older girl, where he raped and murdered her.

90.title: 3 boys kill man in front of daughter over rivalry with his son in Pune
90.article_body: Three minor boys reportedly hacked a 52-year-old man to death in front of his daughter over an old rivalry with his son in Pune. The incident took place when the deceased had gone to pick up his daughter from school, according to reports. The trio's rivalry with the deceased's son was apparently over a girl in their college.

91.title: Request PM to give justice to Bilkis Bano: Owaisi on release of rapists
91.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised the Centre after 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were granted remission. "There is a government circular that says the rapists should not be remitted on Independence Day and BJP has taken the decision against that too. We request PM Modi with folded hands to give justice to her." said Owaisi.

92.title: Mumbai Police constable rapes sex worker after failed raid
92.article_body: A constable of the MHB Police Station allegedly raped a sex worker in Mumbai. The police had conducted a raid to bust a prostitution racket which failed as they could not apply charges of solicitation. Later the accused, Rajratan Kale (42), took the victim to a hotel and allegedly raped her. The complaint was filed at the Kanakia Police Station.

93.title: What is the controversy over IRCTC's tender to monetise passenger data?
93.article_body: IRCTC has floated a tender to hire a consultant to study its customers' personal data with an aim to monetise it, the company's website showed. The tender has sparked concerns regarding the data privacy of customers. As per the tender, the hired consultant will be required to study customer data, including name, mobile number, e-mail ID, and login or password.

94.title: Arrested TMC leader Anubrata taken to hospital for medical check-up
94.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal, arrested in a cattle smuggling case, was taken for a medical check-up and will later be produced in court today. He was reportedly summoned several times by the CBI to appear for questioning, however, he evaded the summons citing his health. He was arrested on August 11 from his residence in Birbhum, West Bengal.

95.title: UN calls for release of Saudi woman sentenced to 34 yrs for tweeting
95.article_body: The UN Human Rights Office, OHCHR, expressed outrage over a 34-year prison sentence handed down to Saudi student Salma al-Shehab in connection with a series of tweets and retweets on political and human rights issues in Saudi Arabia. "We urge...Saudi authorities to quash her conviction and release her immediately," OHCHR spokesperson Liz Throssell said. The 34-year-old was arrested in 2021.

96.title: Need to ensure cricketing demands are fulfilled more than anything: Pandit
96.article_body: KKR head coach Chandrakant Pandit said he will try to be flexible in his methods while coaching the KKR players but added he will ensure cricketing demands are fulfilled more than anything else. Discussing Pandit's recent appointment, former India opener Aakash Chopra had said, "Pandit scolds the players a lot...Will the same strategy work with the international players?"

97.title: Centre worried about Kejriwal, not corruption: Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia
97.article_body: After CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday, the AAP leader accused the Centre of using the investigation agencies to further political motives. "Corruption is not what PM Narendra Modi is worried about...The Centre is just worried about the meteoric rise of...Kejriwal," Sisodia said. "BJP is...using...CBI and ED to implicate Opposition leaders in false cases," he said.

98.title: Woman gets ₹4 lakh compensation after being asked her age at Domino's interview in UK
98.article_body: A woman who was asked her age during a job interview at Domino's Pizza in Northern Ireland's County Tyrone has received an apology and a financial settlement of £4,250 (around ₹4 lakh). She believed she was turned down for the role of delivery driver due to her age and sex. She then filed a discrimination case against the franchise.

99.title: Barcelona star Lewandowski's watch worth ₹56 lakh stolen, thief buries the watch
99.article_body: Barcelona forward Robert Lewandowski's watch worth €70,000 (₹56 lakh) was stolen after he stopped to sign autographs for fans outside the club's practice facilities. The thief opened the passenger door of Lewandowski's car and swiped the watch. Lewandowski tried to chase him but he ran away. Later, police tracked down and detained the thief, who had buried the watch.

100.title: Snap halts work on selfie drone Pixy months after launch: Report
100.article_body: Snap is shutting down development of future versions of Pixy, a drone-powered camera that can record videos and photos to be shared on the Snapchat app, The Wall Street Journal reported. The decision comes less than four months after Snap CEO Evan Spiegel unveiled the device. The company plans to continue selling the current version of Pixy, the report said.

101.title: 2 drivers killed, 10 students injured as K'taka school bus collides with another bus
101.article_body: Two people were killed after a school bus collided with another bus heading in the opposite direction in Athani in Belagavi district of Karnataka. Ten students were also injured in the incident. The incident took place in the early hours of Saturday. Those who lost their lives in the incident include drivers of both the vehicles.

102.title: Flash flood-like situation near Dehradun; video of Tapkeshwar temple surfaces
102.article_body: A flash flood-like situation was reported from various areas in Uttarakhand's Dehradun following a cloudburst. A video from Tapkeshwar Mahadev temple has surfaced online. Tamasa river nearby breached its banks due to continuous torrential rainfall. "Due to this...contact of Mata Vaishno Devi Cave Yoga Temple and Tapkeshwar Mahadev has been lost...pool has been damaged," the temple's founder said.

103.title: JP Nadda to visit poll-bound Himachal to discuss poll strategy
103.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda is set to visit Nahan in Himachal Pradesh to chalk out strategy for the upcoming Assembly elections to be held later this year. "I am on a very emotional two-day visit to Himachal Pradesh. I will get the opportunity to visit Nahan, where I worked for the organisation in my youth," Nadda said.

104.title: CBI's plumes are saffron: Kapil Sibal after raids on Sisodia
104.article_body: Former Congress leader Kapil Sibal called the CBI an "uncaged parrot" after the probe agency conducted raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "CBI, once a 'caged parrot' is now uncaged. Now, its plumes are saffron...It parrots what his master says!" said Sibal. Raids were conducted in seven states in connection with the alleged excise policy scam.

105.title: UP university bars over 9,800 students from exams for mass copying
105.article_body: A university in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj has debarred over 9,800 students from giving examinations for a year after they were allegedly found guilty of mass copying during annual examinations, university officials said on Friday. The administration of Prof Rajendra Singh (Rajju Bhaiya) University had conducted surprise inspections during various semester examinations, officials added.

106.title: CJI NV Ramana inaugurates new City Courts Complex in Vijayawada
106.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana inaugurated the new City Courts Complex in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada on Saturday. Built at a cost of ₹100 crore, the complex will house all courts under one roof. It's spread over an area of about 15,000 square metres and has 29 court halls with special chambers for sessions judges and magistrates, among other facilities.

107.title: Educational institutions shut in Himachal's Mandi amid heavy rains
107.article_body: Owing to the incessant rains, all government and private educational institutions except colleges and ITI will be closed throughout Mandi, Himachal Pradesh. Kullu district administration has also announced to shut all the schools and Anganwadi Centres. Heavy rainfall has battered many parts of the state and due to this several roads are blocked.

108.title: 11 arrested in separate cases, including theft, across Bengaluru
108.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Friday arrested 11 people in separate cases across the city. Ten people were arrested in Bengaluru's Chikkajala area in four different cases of theft, DCP (North East), Anoop A Shetty tweeted. Further, one person was arrested in Devanahalli police station limits for creating fake land documents, Shetty said, adding that he was sent to judicial custody.

109.title: IFS officer shares pic of animal's jaw, asks people to guess name
109.article_body: IFS officer Surender Mehra shared a picture of an animal's jaw and asked people if they could guess its name. He later also shared a picture showing the "full view" of the image. Responding to the officer's tweet, several users of the social media platform commented that it is a "ghariyal".

110.title: Nepal opens its first-ever human milk bank for at-risk infants
110.article_body: Nepal President Bidya Devi Bhandari on Friday inaugurated the nation's first-ever human milk bank at a maternity and women's hospital in Kathmandu. The centre has been established in partnership between the Government of Nepal, European Union and UNICEF. "The milk bank...gives premature...and other at-risk infants access to the vast benefits of breastmilk when they need it the most," UNICEF said.

111.title: Facebook contractors chosen 'at random' by an algorithm fired in US: Report
111.article_body: US-based Accenture recently told some of its employees that their work for Facebook "was soon being taken away", Insider has reported. The contractors, who were employed by Meta, were reportedly informed about their termination during a video call with nameless Accenture representatives. As many as 60 contractors were told they had been chosen for layoff "at random" via an algorithm.

112.title: Had LG not changed excise policy, Delhi would make ₹10,000 cr per yr: Dy CM
112.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that had Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) not changed the decision on the excise policy, the Delhi government would have been getting at least ₹10,000 crore every year. "Excise policy due to which whole controversy is created is the country's best policy," he added. CBI on Friday raided Sisodia's residence.

113.title: Kejriwal on the rise, so time for BJP to destabilise: Kapil Sibal
113.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal took a swipe at CBI, ED and BJP-led government over raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "Sisodia raided by CBI. CBI, ED - the long arms of government. Now that [CM Arvind] Kejriwal is on the rise. Time for BJP to destabilise. So target [AAP leader] Satyendar Jain. Now Sisodia," tweeted Sibal.

114.title: CBI raid not over corruption, but to stop Arvind Kejriwal: Sisodia
114.article_body: After CBI raided his residence over an alleged liquor policy scam, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the raid wasn't over corruption but to "stop the rise" of the national capital's CM Arvind Kejriwal. "I haven't done any corruption. I'm just...Kejriwal's Education Minister," he added. "Their target is Arvind Kejriwal because he works for development," he further said.

115.title: Video shows railway bridge collapsing amid flash flood in Himachal Pradesh
115.article_body: A railway bridge built on Chakki river in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh collapsed amid flash flood and heavy rainfall. A video of the incident has also surfaced online. Mandi district also saw flash flooding on Saturday, with water entering houses and shops, trapping residents and damaging vehicles parked on the road, officials said.

116.title: Mexico arrests former Attorney General in 2014 missing students' case
116.article_body: Mexico's former Attorney General has been arrested in connection with the disappearance of 43 students in September 2014. Jesus Karam, who led an inquiry into the disappearance, has been charged with forced disappearance, torture and obstruction of justice. The students reportedly went missing while travelling by bus through the city of Iguala on their way to a protest.

117.title: Xiaomi's Q2 revenue falls 20% to $10.31 bn, net income drops 67%
117.article_body: China's Xiaomi posted a revenue of 70.17 billion yuan ($10.31 billion) in the second quarter of this year, recording a year-on-year drop of 20%. The consumer electronics maker's adjusted net income also dropped 67% year-on-year in Q2. Xiaomi President Wang Xiang said the resurgence of the COVID-19 pandemic in the country resulted in "difficult and weak" demand.

118.title: Teacher threatens student with physical abuse over BTS remark, later apologises
118.article_body: A teacher has apologised after a video of him mocking and threatening to beat up a female student went viral. The student had allegedly spammed the comments section of the online class with South Korean boy band-related messages. Mocking her for liking BTS, Misra had said, "If you weren't a girl, I would have grabbed your collar and slapped you."

119.title: Maybe within 3-4 days, CBI-ED will arrest me: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia
119.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that CBI-ED might arrest him within the next three-four days. "We won't be scared, you won't be able to break us...the elections of 2024 will be AAP vs BJP," he added. CBI has named 15 accused, including Sisodia, in its FIR over the Centre's allegations of corruption in the liquor policy.

120.title: Pregnant woman abducted, gangraped by 4 men for 3 days in UP
120.article_body: A two-month pregnant woman on Friday alleged she was abducted and gangraped by four men over a period of three days in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi district, police said. When a police team reached the house where she was allegedly held captive, a woman there claimed the survivor's relatives had left her there in exchange for ₹80,000, police added.

121.title: Girls & boys sitting together in class will cause problems: IUML leader
121.article_body: Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) leader PMA Salam has triggered a controversy while criticising gender-neutral education in Kerala schools. "What is the need for girls and boys to sit together in classrooms? Why are you forcing them or creating such opportunities? It will only cause problems," Salam said, according to India Today. "Students will deviate from studies," he added.

122.title: Wasn't offered 'Udta Punjab', had to convince director for role: Alia
122.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said 'Udta Punjab' is the only film where she did "method acting", adding she had to convince director Abhishek Chaubey for her role, having not been offered originally. "He wasn't sure...I worked bloody hard [and convinced him]," added Alia. "I didn't have a phone...I had no entertainment...I learned hockey for one month for...one shot," she stated.

123.title: K'taka CM Bommai orders probe into death threat calls to Siddaramaiah
123.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday ordered a thorough investigation into death threat calls to Congress MLA and Opposition leader Siddaramaiah. "We have taken this issue seriously. I have given instruction to provide adequate security to the Leader of the Opposition," Bommai added. This comes after Siddaramaiah claimed that he received death threats over his remarks on Veer Savarkar.

124.title: 38-year-old man stabbed to death in Delhi; suspects identified
124.article_body: A 38-year-old grocery shop owner was stabbed to death in Delhi's Bhajanpura, police said on Friday. The man was found unconscious at his shop, following which he was taken to a hospital where he was declared brought dead, a police officer said. The police added that four suspects were spotted escaping from the scene on CCTV and they've been identified.

125.title: Bridgerton actress Phoebe visits India, shares pics of Taj Mahal, Humayun's Tomb
125.article_body: Actress Phoebe Dynevor of Bridgerton fame recently visited India and shared pictures of Taj Mahal in Agra and Humayun's Tomb in Delhi. "A few from the past couple of months. Cairo to Delhi to Seoul. What a beautiful ride," she wrote on Instagram. The other pictures include Great Sphinx of Giza and the Pyramids in Egypt.

126.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against Zimbabwe
126.article_body: Team India captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Zimbabwe in the second ODI in Harare. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Shardul Thakur replacing Deepak Chahar. Zimbabwe have made 2 changes to their playing XI. Notably, India are on a 13-match winning streak in ODI cricket against Zimbabwe.

127.title: Sachin played me the best, all other batters were scared: Akhtar on 1999 WC
127.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said all batters except Sachin Tendulkar were "scared" of him during the 1999 World Cup. "Many batters...[would] stop moving their feet...Sachin played me the best," added Akhtar. Akhtar earlier admitted he wanted to "intentionally hit" Sachin during a Test match in Karachi in 2006. "I hit him on his helmet and I thought...he'll die," he'd stated.

128.title: Pune Municipal Corporation to start heritage walk from today
128.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will begin a heritage walk from today in a bid to raise awareness about the city's history. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said that there are around 250 heritage structures in Pune and added, "It's become necessary to conserve its rich historical and cultural importance in...fast progressing era." 'Know Pune' heritage walk will be launched first.

129.title: 1 killed, 13 others feared dead in flash flood, landslide in Himachal's Mandi
129.article_body: At least one person was killed and 13 others are feared dead in a landslide and flash flood amid heavy rains in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi, officials said. A girl's body was recovered about half a kilometre away from her house in the Baghi Nullah area on Friday night, while five members of her family were washed away, officials added.

130.title: 81-yr-old Danish woman arrested at Poland airport with 5 kg heroin
130.article_body: An 81-year-old Danish woman, carrying five kilograms of heroin worth over $515,000, was arrested at Frederic Chopin Airport in Poland, officials said. The woman was travelling from Malawi and Kenya to Canada via Qatar and Poland. Customs officers decided to check the woman's luggage after becoming suspicious of her uneasy behaviour. The heroin was discovered under a false suitcase bottom.

131.title: Paytm spends ₹600 crore on tech every year: CFO Madhur Deora
131.article_body: Paytm spends ₹600 crore on tech every year, the company's Group Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Madhur Deora said at the company's annual general meeting (AGM) on Friday. This is besides the ₹4,000 crore the company spends on employee-related costs, Deora added. He further said that the company's employee attrition rate is in the range of 2 to 2.5% per month.

132.title: Chakki bridge in Himachal's Kangra collapses due to heavy rains, video surfaces
132.article_body: Chakki bridge in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district collapsed on Saturday, ADM Kangra said. Reports said that the bridge collapsed due to heavy rainfall and floods in the area. A video of the incident went viral on social media. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is likely to take place in Kangra, Chamba, Bilaspur, Sirmaur and Mandi districts of Himachal Pradesh today, reports added.

133.title: Adani Power to acquire DB Power for ₹7,017 crore in all-cash deal
133.article_body: Adani Power has announced that it will acquire DB Power for an enterprise value of ₹7,017 crore in an all-cash deal. DB Power owns and operates a thermal power plant in Chhattisgarh. Following the acquisition, Adani Power will own 100% of DPPL, the holding company of DB Power. The deal is subject to approval from the Competition Commission of India.

134.title: Heroes are just 'too emotional', too much 'chik-chik': Rhea Kapoor
134.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor's daughter and producer Rhea Kapoor took to Instagram to share that women are "braver" and "more fun" than men. "I'm not interested in making 'women-centric' films. What the f**k is a 'women-centric' film? My films just happen to have women," added Rhea. "Also, heroes are just too sensitive and emotional. Too much chik-chik. Na?" she stated.

135.title: 3 people missing after house collapses following landslide in HP's Chamba
135.article_body: Three people went missing after a house collapsed following a landslide triggered by heavy rains in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba district on Saturday, ANI reported. The incident occurred around 4:30 am and a search operation has been launched, officials said. Earlier this morning, a flash flood was also reported in state's Mandi district, causing water to enter houses and damaging vehicles.

136.title: Tharoor shares pic of Rajiv Gandhi's pilot licence on his birth anniversary
136.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a picture of Rajiv Gandhi's private pilot licence on the former PM's birth anniversary. "Remembering Rajiv Gandhi on what would have been his 78th birthday. He piloted the nation to greater heights but was cruelly snatched from us in mid-flight," he tweeted. Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated in 1991.

137.title: Rakesh Tikait asks farmers to be ready for nationwide agitation
137.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait has asked farmers to be ready for a nationwide agitation over their demands, including a law on MSP and the removal of Union Minister Ajay Misra Teni. He was addressing farmers at a sit-in organised by Samyukta Kisan Morcha. "If SKM gets weakened, governments will get the better of farmers," Tikait said.

138.title: Rahul, Priyanka pay tributes to Rajiv Gandhi on his 78th birth anniversary
138.article_body: On the occasion of former PM Rajiv Gandhi's 78th birth anniversary, Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi paid tributes to their father at Vir Bhumi, Delhi. Posting a video on Twitter, Rahul Gandhi wrote, "Papa, you are with me every moment, in my heart. I will always try to fulfil the dream you dreamed for the country."

139.title: Pune sisters aged 17, 10, on way to school, die as lorry hits 2-wheeler
139.article_body: Two sisters, aged 17 and 10, died on Saturday morning after a speeding container lorry hit the two-wheeler they were riding on, police said. The incident took place on Pune-Solapur Highway. The sisters were on their way to school along with their uncle when the accident took place around 7 am, police added. Their uncle was injured in the incident.

140.title: Punjab declared 'controlled area' after African swine fever confirmed in Patiala
140.article_body: The entire state of Punjab has been declared as "controlled area" after African swine fever was confirmed in swine samples of Patiala, Punjab Animal Husbandry Minister Laljit Singh Bhullar on Friday said. Bilaspur and Sanauri Adda in Patiala are hereby notified as "epicentre" of the disease, he added. Samples of unwell pigs from Patiala were sent to Bhopal for testing.

141.title: Challenge BJP to get article published in NYT: AAP MLA on 'paid news' remark
141.article_body: Reacting to BJP leaders' allegations that a New York Times (NYT) article on Delhi schools was "paid news", AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said that he challenged BJP to use whatever money and power they have to get an article published in NYT if they think it's possible. "The donation [BJP] get is...maximum...Why couldn't you get paid news published?" he said.

142.title: Putin agrees to send IAEA mission to Ukraine nuclear plant
142.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin held talks with French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday and has agreed to send an International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) mission to the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, the French presidency said. This comes as claims of fighting near the plant continue. The plant has been under the control of Russian troops since March.

143.title: New species of white & purple crab recognised in Karnataka; pic released
143.article_body: Karnataka Forest Department has released a picture of a new species of crab called 'Ghatiana dvivarna' that has been recognised in Idagundi Range of Yellapur Division. It's white and purple in colour. "Ghatiana dvivarna inhabits holes in the laterite rocks on the mountains of central Western Ghats. This is the 75th crab species recognised in Western Ghats," the department said.

144.title: Vaishno Devi Yatra resumes after temporary suspension
144.article_body: The Vaishno Devi Yatra in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra has resumed after a temporary suspension due to flash floods triggered by heavy rainfall in the region. "The police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) have already been deployed. The situation is being monitored. No untoward incident reported so far," Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said.

145.title: Baseless: DOLO-650 makers on allegations of spending ₹1,000 crore on doctors
145.article_body: Bengaluru-based Micro Labs Limited has said allegations against the pharmaceutical firm that it spent ₹1,000 crore on doctors to prescribe it are "baseless and incorrect". "The brand did a business of just ₹350 crore when COVID-19 was at its peak, and, therefore, it was simply unviable for us to promote the drug by spending a much larger amount," it added.

146.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts on August 21 & 22
146.article_body: Several parts of Bengaluru will face planned power cuts on August 21 and 22 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) will carry out repair and maintenance works. Most of the work will be done between 10 am and 6 pm, News18 reported. The areas that will be affected on Sunday include Vivek Nagar, Victoria Layout, Richmond Park etc.

147.title: 6 die, 20 injured as tractor-trailer, truck collides in Raj; PM expresses grief
147.article_body: At least six people were killed and over 20 were injured as a tractor-trailer carrying pilgrims and a truck collided in Rajasthan's Pali on Friday night, police said. The pilgrims were returning from Jaisalmer's Ramdevra, where a temple of a folk deity is located. "In this hour of grief, my thoughts are with the bereaved families," PM Narendra Modi said.

148.title: K'taka reduces fellowship amount by 66% for minority PhD, MPhil students
148.article_body: Karnataka government has reduced the fellowship amount by 66% for minority PhD and MPhil students who joined in the academic year 2022-23. For PhD scholars who joined in 2020-21 and 2021-22, the fellowship amount has been reduced by 33%. The reduction is a result of depleting revenue of the state government due to COVID-19, the state Minority Welfare Department said.

149.title: Man sells newborn daughter for ₹6,000 in Assam; 3 arrested
149.article_body: A man allegedly sold his newborn daughter for ₹6,000 to another person in Assam's Biswanath, police said on Friday. Three people, including the man, have been arrested and the baby was rescued, according to police. The man's father had filed a complaint after he got suspicious when his son told him the baby had passed away at the hospital.

150.title: One should stop talking about it: Dortmund CEO on Ronaldo being linked
150.article_body: Hans-Joachim Watzke, the CEO of Bundesliga club Borussia Dortmund, said there's no contact "at all" between the club and Cristiano Ronaldo, over a potential move from Manchester United. "One should stop talking about it," added Watzke. Bayern Munich and Atletico Madrid earlier denied reports of Ronaldo being signed. AC Milan and Inter Milan reportedly rejected an opportunity to sign Ronaldo.

151.title: BJP expels OBC leader over 'Brahmins were fooling people' comment
151.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP expelled OBC leader Pritam Singh Lodhi from the party for six years after his comment on the Brahmin community. "Brahmins were fooling people in the name of offering religious rituals and prayers, and grabbing money and other things from commoners," Lodhi had said. He later said he would apologise to Brahmins "with his head at their feet".

152.title: Trudeau nominates 1st indigenous person to Canada's Supreme Court
152.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has nominated Michelle O'Bonsawin as the first indigenous person to serve on Canada's Supreme Court. The move comes following decades of criticism over a lack of indigenous representation on the country's highest court. O'Bonsawin will take up her new position as one of nine judges in September after a non-binding vote later this month in Parliament.

153.title: SS Rajamouli 'opened a door' for all of us: Mani Ratnam on Baahubali
153.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam, whose film 'Ponniyin Selvan' starring Aishwarya Rai Bachchan will release in two parts, said SS Rajamouli "opened a door" for everyone, by showing a film can be successful even in two parts. "'Ponniyin Selvan'...became possible because of 'Baahubali'...I...really want to thank him," added Ratnam. Actor Rajinikanth earlier termed it as being on the "scale" of 'Baahubali'.

154.title: India reports 13,272 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,01,166
154.article_body: India has reported 13,272 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 15,754 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,01,166, while the death toll has risen to 5,27,289, according to the latest data.

155.title: 153 people injured during 'Dahi Handi' in Mumbai, 23 still under treatment
155.article_body: A total of 153 people were injured while forming the pyramid during 'Dahi Handi' in Mumbai, news agency ANI reported. Of the total, 130 people have been discharged while 23 others are still undergoing treatment. Meanwhile, Thane Municipal Corporation said that around 64 people were injured in the city during the 'Dahi Handi' celebrations.

156.title: US govt body condemns release of Bilkis rape convicts, says 'part of pattern in India'
156.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano and killing her family members were released, the US Commission on International Religious Freedom said, "USCIRF strongly condemns the early and unjustified release." Calling it a "travesty of justice", it added, "It's part of a pattern of impunity in India for those engaged in violence against religious minorities."

157.title: Raj only state where govt takes immediate action against crimes: Gehlot
157.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said crimes occur across the country, but Rajasthan is the only state where government takes immediate action against them. "They (BJP) will call it 'Jungle Raj', but people understand everything and are supporting us," Gehlot added. His statement came after a nine-year-old Dalit boy was allegedly beaten to death by his teacher in Jalore.

158.title: Cloudburst in U'khand village, villagers rescued; Tamsa water level rises
158.article_body: A cloudburst took place in a village in Dehradun district of Uttarakhand on Saturday. Reports said that there has been a rise in the water level of Tamsa river. The state disaster response force (SDRF) rushed to the spot after residents of the village reported the cloudburst at 2.45 am. SDRF said all stranded villagers were rescued.

159.title: 5.2 magnitude earthquake hits Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow
159.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 5.2 on the Richter scale hit the north-northeast of Uttar Pradesh capital Lucknow at around 1.12 am on Saturday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) said. The depth of the earthquake was 82 kilometres below the ground, it added. Reportedly, tremors were felt in neighbouring Lakhimpur Kheri and other districts of Uttar Pradesh and Delhi.

160.title: British High Commissioner trolls Manchester United fan at Delhi temple, shares video
160.article_body: British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis took to Twitter to share a video of himself trolling a Manchester United fan at the ISKCON temple in Delhi. In the video, the fan can be heard telling Ellis that Lord Krishna will help Manchester United win, to which Ellis says, "Lord Krishna has a great sense of humour. Don't forget that."

161.title: Amazon sells obscene Radha-Krishna painting; police complaint filed in Bengaluru
161.article_body: Hindu Janajagruti Samiti has filed a police complaint against Amazon in Bengaluru after an obscene Radha-Krishna painting was being sold on the platform. 'Boycott Amazon' also started trending on social media over sale of the painting. Demanding unconditional apology, the Hindu organisation later claimed that Amazon "quietly" removed the painting from its site.

162.title: 8 people killed as militants take control of hotel in Somalia, say 'we'll shoot everyone'
162.article_body: At least eight civilians have been killed by al-Shabab militants who have taken control of a hotel in the Somali capital Mogadishu. In a statement, the militants said, "We'll shoot everyone." An affiliate of al-Qaeda, al-Shabab has engaged in a long running conflict with the federal government.

163.title: Speeding car hits 2 kids on bicycle in Raj; act caught on CCTV
163.article_body: Two children, aged 10 and 12, were seriously injured after a speeding car rammed into the bicycle they were riding on in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh. The CCTV footage of the incident, which took place on Thursday evening, purportedly shows the car speeding away while the children lay on the ground. The children were taken to two separate hospitals.

164.title: A lot of people have a 'crush' on Stefanos Tsitsipas: Venus Williams
164.article_body: Seven-time Grand Slam Champion Venus Williams said a "lot of people" have a "crush" on Greek tennis player Stefanos Tsitsipas, while reacting to a question on Instagram on whether she'd like to coach Tsitsipas. "But I'm...assuming you want me to coach someone with a great game," added Venus. Talking about her least favourite shot, Venus stated, "I can't give...any clues."

165.title: It was our mistake, will honour sales: EA on listing ₹4,799 FIFA 23 game for ₹4.8
165.article_body: Electronic Arts (EA) has admitted that it mistakenly offered the FIFA 23 Ultimate Edition on India's Epic Games store for ₹4.8 instead of ₹4,799 in July. In an email to customers, EA said it "scored a spectacular own-goal" by listing the game at an incorrect price. "It was our mistake...we'll be honouring all pre-purchases made at that price," EA wrote.

166.title: Al-Shabaab militants attack hotel in Somalia
166.article_body: The militant group al-Shabaab on Friday said its fighters have taken control of a hotel in the Somali capital, Mogadishu. The militants detonated two explosives outside the hotel before entering the building and opening fire, police said. In a statement, the terror group said its fighters "are shooting everyone" in the hotel. There's no information about the casualties so far.

167.title: CBI seized my computer, phone; we are not afraid: Sisodia after 14-hr raid at home
167.article_body: After a nearly 14-hour CBI raid at his residence, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said his computer and phone have been seized. "My family cooperated with them...We have not done any corruption or wrong. We are not afraid. We know CBI is being misused," he said, adding that efforts are being made to stop Delhi government's good works.

168.title: IISc Bangalore to get centre of excellence for 3D bioprinting
168.article_body: The Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore, signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with US-based firm CELLINK to set up a centre of excellence (CoE) for 3D bioprinting on its campus. The centre will get state-of-the-art 3D bioprinters from CELLINK, as per the agreement. It will focus on research on heart, bone, cartilage and cancer using 3D bioprinting.

169.title: Mark Zuckerberg sued by family of guard who died on his Hawaii property in 2019
169.article_body: Mark Zuckerberg is being sued by the family of a security guard who died at the billionaire's Hawaiian property in 2019. The guard died after suffering a heart attack when he was forced to climb a steep hill to return to compound, said the lawsuit. The family further alleged that Zuckerberg gave them a $7,500 check after the guard's death.

170.title: Maha labourer, threatened with 'shrap', smashes baba's head, kills him; held
170.article_body: A labourer was arrested after he smashed a self-proclaimed godman's head with a paver block and killed him in Maharashtra. "The accused revealed...he was upset with the baba...Late on August 13, he had come drunk and was reprimanded by the baba who threatened to give him a curse if he again came drunk," police said.

171.title: GHMC speeds up construction of Uppal flyover in Hyderabad
171.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has sped up work on the Uppal flyover. The civic body's standing committee recently approved an administrative sanction of ₹12 crore for relocation of power and water lines, which were causing a delay. Expected to cost ₹675 crore, the flyover will begin at Uppal Junction and end at Central Power Research Institute in Medipally.

172.title: 2 die, 6 injured during Janmashtami celebrations at Mathura's Bankey Bihari temple
172.article_body: At least two persons died and six others were injured during Janmashtami celebrations on Friday at Bankey Bihari temple in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, officials said. "During Mangala Aarti...one devotee fainted at the exit gate of the temple due to which movement of devotees was restricted," police added. "As there was a huge crowd, many inside the premises suffocated," police stated.

173.title: Residents claim builder vandalised temple in Gurugram; probe on
173.article_body: A probe is being conducted after residents of a society in Gurugram's Sector 109 filed complaints alleging that a builder and his aides vandalised a temple they were constructing and threatened them, police said.
