"These allegations are baseless. The...land has been allotted for a school," the builder told Indian Express. A police officer said that no case has been registered.

174.title: US asks judge to block $2.2 billion merger of Penguin Random House and Simon and Schuster
174.article_body: The Department of Justice urged a US judge to block a $2.2-billion merger of Penguin Random House and Simon and Schuster book publishers. It said that competition matters, adding that the industry shouldn't be treated differently from others. The largest five publishers control 90% of the market, and the combined company would control about half of it, the government said.

175.title: Bengaluru reports 935 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
175.article_body: Bengaluru reported 935 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,56,779 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Friday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,981. The number of active cases was 6,989, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.74%.

176.title: Mumbai fashion store director dead; drink bottle, packets of tablets found
176.article_body: The director of Suvidha Fashion Store in Dadar was found dead on Thursday. Police suspect that the 46-year-old director died by suicide. Reports said that police found a soft drink bottle and empty packets of tablets near the body. The family said that the deceased had earlier attempted suicide four times and that he suffered from psychological problems.

177.title: Man killed in shooting at shopping centre in Sweden; teen arrested
177.article_body: Swedish police on Friday arrested a teenage boy for allegedly killing one man and injuring a woman in a shooting at a shopping centre in Malmo. Police have ruled out a possible "terrorist" motive and said the shooting appeared to be "an isolated incident connected to criminal groups". So far this year, 44 people have been shot dead in Sweden.

178.title: I was 1000% nervous that Trump's supporters would kill me: Alec Baldwin on 'Rust' incident
178.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin, who accidentally shot cinematographer Halyna Hutchins dead on sets of 'Rust', said he was 1000% nervous that Donald Trump's supporters would kill him after Trump's remark that Baldwin probably shot her on purpose. He added, “Here was Trump...who instructed people to commit acts of violence...and he was pointing...fingers at me and saying...I was responsible for the death."

179.title: Sunken German WWII ships resurface in Danube River amid drought in Europe
179.article_body:
Explosives-laden German warships sunk during the World War-II have resurfaced after drought 
in Europe pushed Danube River to one of its lowest levels in almost a century. The ammunition on the ships can be dangerous to shipping, according to reports. "The German flotilla has left behind a big ecological disaster," said Velimir Trajilovic, who wrote a book on German ships.

180.title: Steve Jobs' Apple-1 computer prototype sells for over ₹5.4 crore in auction
180.article_body: Late Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs' Apple-1 computer prototype has been bought by a Bay Area collector in an auction for $677,196 (over ₹5.4 crore). The prototype was used by Jobs in 1976 to demonstrate the Apple-1 to Paul Terrell, owner of The Byte Shop in California, one of the first personal computer stores in the world, Boston-based RR Auction said.

181.title: Thought of drinking for Darlings, director said 'Stay away from alcohol': Vijay
181.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who plays actress Alia Bhatt's drunk husband in 'Darlings', said he thought of getting drunk and performing scenes with the assistants in their office. However, director Jasmeet K Reen said, "You please stay away from alcohol, because you are not at all Hamza when you are drunk". Vijay added that there was constant grin on his face.

182.title: Water supply to be hit across Pune on August 25 due to PMC works
182.article_body: There will be no supply of water across Pune on August 25. "[Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC)] has planned meter installation, maintenance and water supply line connection works at many areas, including Parvati and Cantonment water treatment plants," a PMC official said. However, the areas which are supplied water from the Bhama Askhed Dam won't be affected on the same day.

183.title: Dumper for Metro project falls into trench, driver dies in Pune
183.article_body: A 46-year-old dumper driver died after the vehicle fell into an about 25-feet-deep trench in Pune's Katraj, police said. This comes after the driver lost control of the dumper which was carrying raw material for the Metro project at Swargate, police added. "The driver received major injuries, eventually resulting in his death," police further said.

184.title: Man beaten up, head shaved on suspicion of theft in Delhi's Wazirabad
184.article_body: A man was allegedly caught and beaten after being tied to a pole in Delhi's Wazirabad on suspicion of theft. A video of the incident surfaced online, following which police filed a case. In the video, the man's hair is also purportedly shaved with a razor. The locals caught him red-handed after he allegedly stole a water motor, police said.

185.title: Finnish PM Sanna Marin takes drugs test after her party video goes viral
185.article_body: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin on Friday said that she had taken a drugs test after a video of her partying went viral on social media. Vowing that she had never used illegal drugs, Marin further said her ability to perform her official duties had remained unimpaired. Marin became the world's youngest serving government leader in December 2019.

186.title: It'll work in any language except 'Hindi': Vijay on Samantha-starrer Kushi
186.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said his film 'Kushi', starring actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, will be released only in Southern states of India, adding it'll "work in any language except Hindi". "It's related to the script," added Deverakonda. "[A] lot of [aspects in first half]...come from me not knowing Hindi...If I release...[in] Hindi, I need to be a Hindi guy," he stated.

187.title: Hyd man poses as woman to blackmail people on social media, arrested
187.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested a man for posing as a woman on social media and blackmailing people. The accused reportedly initiated explicit video calls with victims after pretending to be a female fashion designer and demanded money by blackmailing them with screen recordings. According to police, the accused had been a victim of a similar scam in past.

188.title: SRK is full of energy round the clock like Ranveer Singh is now: Ramya Krishnan
188.article_body: Actress Ramya Krishnan said that actor Shah Rukh Khan is full of energy like actor "Ranveer Singh is now". "[Shah Rukh Khan] is such a sweetheart. It's been ages since I've seen him...A lovely person to work with, lovely co-star, very understanding. Though I was very new then...he was really nice to me," she added.

189.title: I know it was pretty basic: Zuckerberg after being mocked over metaverse selfie
189.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has responded after he was mocked for posting a low-resolution selfie of his metaverse avatar. Sharing another picture on Instagram, Zuckerberg said, "I know the photo I posted earlier...was pretty basic -- it was taken very quickly to celebrate a launch." He announced that there will be "major updates" to Meta's VR platform, Horizon Worlds, soon.

190.title: Hawala agent with terror links operating as Delhi trader arrested
190.article_body: An alleged Hawala operator was arrested from Jammu bus stand by Delhi Police and Jammu & Kashmir Police with the help of central agencies, officials said on Friday. The accused identified as Mohammad Yasin allegedly contributed to funding of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Al-Badr terror groups. Yasin was reportedly operating under the guise of a garment trader from Delhi's Meena Bazar.

191.title: Delhi logs 1,417 fresh COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
191.article_body: Delhi reported 1,417 new cases of COVID-19 on Friday and three deaths due to the infection, according to data shared by the health department. Delhi's COVID-19 death toll reached 26,411 with the fresh fatalities. The city witnessed a decline in its test positivity rate as a rate of 7.53% was registered on Friday against Thursday's 9.42%.

192.title: He has fantastic temperament: Ferguson as character witness for Giggs
192.article_body: Ex-Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson was called in as a character witness for his ex-player Ryan Giggs' trial. Ferguson told the court that Giggs had "fantastic temperament", adding that Giggs fulfilled everything they wished for and never lost his temper in front of him. Giggs is on trial on charges of assault and use of coercive behaviour against an ex-girlfriend.

193.title: Rice mill owned by Mondal's daughter raided, ₹30-lakh car found: Report
193.article_body: The CBI on Friday raided a rice mill owned by arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal's daughter, Sukanya, in West Bengal's Bolpur. "Five cars were parked inside the rice mill premises. A Ford Endeavour [worth around] ₹30 lakh was also found...This car...was often used by Mondal when he used to come to Kolkata from Bolpur," a report said quoting CBI officials.

194.title: CBI raids won't scare Manish Sisodia or AAP: Akhilesh Yadav
194.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said CBI raids on Manish Sisodia will not scare the Delhi Deputy CM or the AAP. "The BJP is frightened that the AAP is going to upset their plans in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat," added Yadav. He said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar breaking his alliance with the BJP was a good message to the opposition.

195.title: Railways to launch Mathura-Vrindavan intercity rail bus soon
195.article_body: On the occasion of the Janmashtami festival, the Indian Railways has announced that an intercity rail bus from Mathura to Vrindavan will be launched soon. The rail bus' capacity will be 50 passengers. The Ministry of Railways shared pictures of the rail bus on Twitter. Vrindavan is connected to Mathura by a 12 km long meter gauge rail track.

196.title: Girl run over by truck while trying to escape kidnappers in Bihar
196.article_body: A teenage girl in Bihar died after being run over by a truck while she was reportedly escaping her abductors. Two men allegedly abducted the girl on their motorcycle and she managed to fling herself off the running vehicle but was crushed under the truck behind them. Locals beat up the truck driver while the alleged abductors managed to escape.

197.title: 2 hybrid terrorists with arms & ammunition arrested in Kupwara
197.article_body: Two suspected hybrid terrorists were arrested by security forces in J&K's Kupwara district, police said on Friday. The duo was arrested following a lead received during the investigation of a case in which three hybrid terrorists were arrested in Handwara on August 4, police added. Two pistols and 58 pistol rounds were recovered from the duo's possession, police informed.

198.title: Still believe I belong: Daniel Ricciardo on F1 future rumours
198.article_body: Amid rumours about his future at McLaren and F1, Daniel Ricciardo said he "still thrives off" the sport and believes he "belongs". "I could probably keep going, but there are a few things...I still believe I belong and can do it," said Ricciardo. Reports said the team is looking to replace Ricciardo with F2 champion Oscar Piastri next year.

199.title: Brilliant effort from team: Elgar on SA winning 1st Test vs England on Day 3
199.article_body: After South Africa won the first Test against England by an innings and 12 runs, South Africa captain Dean Elgar said it was a brilliant effort from the team and they didn't expect the game to finish so quickly. South Africa won the match on third day. Kagiso Rabada was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 5/52 and 2/27.

200.title: I would love ODIs to continue, have some meaning: Scott Styris
200.article_body: Former New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said that he would love the ODI format to continue and have some meaning apart from only being featured at the Cricket World Cup. "I felt ODI was a mixture of power...Power, speed...all of that kicks in as well as the traditional cricket where there is the rotation of the strike," Styris said.

201.title: Wish for peaceful relations with India based on equity: Pak PM
201.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said he wishes for peaceful relations with India on the basis of "equity, justice and mutual respect", local media reported on Friday. "The international community has to play a facilitative role...as it was essential for...stability in South Asia," he said. Sharif made the comments during a meeting with the new Australian High Comm­issioner to Pakistan.

202.title: Wasim Jaffer trolls 'Bazball' after South Africa defeat England by an innings and 12 runs
202.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled England over 'Bazball' after South Africa defeated them by an innings and 12 runs in the Lord's Test. Jaffer wrote, "'Bazball has done wonders in the fourth innings'...South Africa: There will be no fourth innings." England were bowled out for 165 in the first innings and 149 in the second innings.

203.title: I have been in favour of IPL's expansion for the past 10 years: Styris
203.article_body: After IPL got an extended window in the recently released 2023-27 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle, former New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said that he has been in "favour" of it. "I was in favour of it 10 years ago...I'm in favour of it now...We are starting to get there [3-month IPL season] now," Styris said.

204.title: Broke a very tough Dahi Handi 1.5 months back: Maha CM Shinde
204.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said he and his supporters "broke a very tough Dahi Handi one-and-a-half months back". "It was very difficult, high, and we had to put up 50 strong layers but we succeeded," said the CM. He was alluding to the rebellion he led against the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena and its alliance with NCP and Congress.

205.title: TN inspector held for alleged role in bank heist; 3.7-kg gold seized
205.article_body: A police inspector was arrested for his alleged role in helping the perpetrators who robbed FedBank in Tamil Nadu's Chennai, police said on Friday. Additional Commissioner of Police TS Anbu said, "Robbery accused Santosh, brother-in-law of [inspector] Amalraj, kept gold [at] Amalraj's residence. Amalraj knew this but didn't inform the police." Police seized 3.7 kg of gold from Amalraj's residence.

206.title: 31 locations across India raided in Delhi excise policy case: CBI
206.article_body: CBI said that it is conducting raids at 31 locations across India including Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and Bengaluru in the Delhi excise policy case. "Searches are being conducted...have led to the recovery of incriminating documents/articles, digital records, etc," said the CBI. The agency is probing a corruption case filed against the introduction of the new Delhi liquor policy.

207.title: Haryana SI sexually harasses physically challenged woman, arrested
207.article_body: A Sub-Inspector (SI) in Haryana's Nuh district has been arrested for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a physically-challenged woman. The SI contacted the woman following an FIR she had registered against her in-laws at Firozpur Jhirka Police Station. The woman alleged the accused demanded sexual favours and threatened to harm her case if his demands were not met.

208.title: Chhattisgarh govt inviting bids to lease out 24 tourism properties
208.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government is inviting bids from "experienced private investors" to lease out 24 state-owned motels and resorts for 30 years. The bids are open till September 5 for 14 non-functional and 10 functional properties under the Chhattisgarh Tourism Board. The initiative is expected to provide facilities to local and foreign tourists and raise employment opportunities, officials said.

209.title: Palestinian shot dead by Israeli forces during raid in West Bank
209.article_body: A 58-year-old man was shot dead by Israeli forces during an arrest raid in the West Bank on Friday, according to the deceased's brother. The raid was aimed at arresting Palestinians suspected of taking part in or planning attacks, the Israeli military said. The military said that its troops shot back after Palestinians opened fire and hurled firebombs at them.

210.title: Looking forward to making India proud again: CWG 2022 gold medallist Sreeja
210.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula, who won a gold medal along with her partner Sharath Kamal in mixed doubles event at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022, said she is looking forward to making her nation proud again. Sreeja and Sharath became the first Indian pair to win gold in mixed doubles in the history of the Commonwealth Games.

211.title: Prefer to play Man Utd after they win 5-0: Liverpool coach Klopp
211.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he would prefer to play against Manchester United if the Red Devils had won their last match 5-0. Klopp said he was wary of a strong comeback from United who had lost their previous match against Brentford 0-4. Liverpool themselves are yet to win their first match of the season after playing two back-to-back draws.

212.title: BJP chief JP Nadda to visit poll-bound Himachal Pradesh
212.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda is set to visit the poll-bound state of Himachal Pradesh and attend various events in Sirmaur on Saturday. He is expected to hold meetings with the leaders of the state unit to deliberate on the strategy for the upcoming Assembly elections. The BJP chief will also be addressing a public meeting in Paonta Sahib.

213.title: Officials give tennis player Bouchard credential with swimsuit pic, change it later
213.article_body: The officials at Odlum Brown VanOpen tournament gave Canadian tennis player Eugenie Bouchard credential with a swimsuit picture of the player. Bouchard took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of the credential, writing, "Can someone from @vanopentennis credential office explain pls??" Hours later, she shared another picture of the credential with her headshot and wrote, "Got a real one."

214.title: Captain Zoya becomes 1st Indian female pilot to be added to US Aviation Museum
214.article_body: Air India's Captain Zoya Agarwal has become the first Indian female pilot to be added to SFO Aviation Museum in the US. She was the first Indian woman pilot to fly an aircraft above the North pole covering a record-breaking distance of around 16,000 km. "I was amazed to see that I’m the only living object over there," said Agarwal

215.title: Sleeping pods for passengers inaugurated at Chennai airport, pics surface
215.article_body: A 'sleeping pod facility', with four bed-sized capsules, was inaugurated at Chennai airport. The 'Sleepzo' facility is located in the arrivals section of domestic terminal, near baggage belt number 1. "The facility can be availed on...hourly basis and has amenities like reading lights, charging stations, USB charger, luggage space, ambient lights, blower control," said Airports Authority of India.

216.title: Which 4 cricketers have taken 100 or more wickets on a single ground?
216.article_body: England's Stuart Broad has become the fourth cricketer after Muttiah Muralitharan, James Anderson and Rangana Herath to take 100 wickets on a single ground. With his three wickets in the Test against South Africa, the 36-year-old took his Test wicket tally at Lord's to 102. Muralitharan is the only cricketer to take 100-plus Test wickets at three separate stadiums each.

217.title: 'India, China must work together for Asian century,' says Jaishankar; China reacts
217.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recently quoted Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping's remarks on India and China, saying, "The Asian century will be difficult to happen if India and China don't come together." Chinese Foreign Ministry backed his remarks, saying China and India have "far more common interests than differences". Jaishankar also said Indo-China relations were in a "difficult phase".

218.title: Islamic State cell member sentenced to life in prison in US for beheadings
218.article_body: A member of an Islamic State cell found guilty in April for his role in hostage-taking plot that led to beheadings of American journalists and aid workers was sentenced to life in prison by a US court. El Shafee Elsheikh was sentenced in Virginia. The ex-British citizen was found guilty of charges including lethal hostage-taking and conspiracy to commit murder.

219.title: Revenue of Indian Railways increased after I played Geet, jokes Kareena
219.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor, during her appearance in the courtroom comedy 'Case Toh Banta Hai', joked that the revenue of Indian Railways increased after the release of her film 'Jab We Met'. "After I played Geet, the sale of harem pants and revenues of Indian Railways both have increased by the way," she said. 'Jab We Met' was released in 2007.

220.title: Fishing trawler capsizes in Bay of Bengal, 5 missing
220.article_body: Five people went missing after a fishing trawler capsized in the Bay of Bengal on Friday, an official of a fishermen's association said. The boat, which had 18 people onboard, capsized near the Kendo island of West Bengal, which marks the end of Sundarbans territory. The 13 rescued fishermen were taken to a hospital in Kakdwip.

221.title: Don't step out: Odisha CM's appeal to 4 districts amid heavy rainfall warning
221.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik appealed to people of four districts including Balasore, Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj and Bhadrak not to venture out of their homes on Saturday amid heavy rainfall forecast. "I appeal to people not to panic but rather follow the instructions of the administration," Patnaik said. The IMD has issued red alert in the four districts for Saturday morning.

222.title: N'Golo Kante out injured for few weeks: Chelsea manager Tuchel
222.article_body: Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said midfielder N'Golo Kante will be sidelined for a few weeks after picking up a hamstring injury during their match against Tottenham Hotspur. "We're talking weeks, which is not good news. We're disappointed and sad," said Tuchel. He added that striker Armando Broja and midfielder Mateo Kovacic are also injured for their next match against Leeds.

223.title: Such incidents keep happening: SBSP chief after girl stripped in UP
223.article_body: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar drew criticism for saying "such incidents keep happening" after a video of a girl being stripped by six men went viral. "The population of UP is 25 crore...there's not enough police to guard every house," he said. The girl and her male friend were reportedly thrashed while they were sitting together in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur.

224.title: Next state budget to be dedicated to youth, students: Raj CM Gehlot
224.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said the state's next budget will be dedicated to the youth, students and over one crore women will be given smartphones. The Gehlot government will be presenting its last budget in 2023. He appealed to the youth and students to give suggestions and said their views will be included in the budget announcements.

225.title: BSF head constable killed in attack by insurgents in Tripura
225.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) head constable, Girjesh Kumar Uddey, was killed in Tripura on Friday after indiscriminate firing by suspected insurgents, officials said. It is believed that some shots were also fired from across the Bangladesh border, officials added. "Uddey was immediately evacuated by helicopter to Agartala, where he later succumbed to the grievous injuries," BSF officials said.

226.title: Madhavan visits India's 1st indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant, shares pics
226.article_body: Actor R Madhavan took to Instagram to share some pictures from his visit to India's first indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant. "My utmost gratitude and thank you for this very special honour. Such a privilege to be invited by the #indiannavy on the indigenously built aircraft carrier soon to be commissioned," he wrote. Recently, actor Mohanlal also visited IAC Vikrant.

227.title: Salute to Dhawan, Pujara for their drive and passion: Kaif
227.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has spoken about Indian batters Shikhar Dhawan and Cheteshwar Pujara. "A salute to Dhawan and Pujara for their drive and passion," Kaif said. The former India U-19 World Cup winning captain added, "No negativity, no complaint, if I have a bat in hand I will score, that's pure love for the game."

228.title: India has been incredibly kind to me: AB de Villiers
228.article_body: After collaborating with an Indian NGO to guide underprivileged children, former South Africa skipper AB de Villiers said that "India has been incredibly kind" to him over the years. "I am always looking for ways to give something back [to India]. I am happy to be associated with MAD (Make A Difference)...Their work is incredible," De Villiers said.

229.title: She's studying overseas: Ajay on daughter's rumoured acting debut
229.article_body: Amid rumours about Nysa Devgn making her Bollywood debut, Ajay Devgn said that his 19-year-old daughter hasn't made up her mind yet. "She's just a teenager. She hasn't told [us] what her...career choice would be. As of now, she's studying overseas," he added. "If she decides to pursue a career in the film industry, it'll be her choice," said Ajay.

230.title: Aaliyah got anxiety after rape threats, I dropped everything & ran to US: Anurag
230.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap revealed that his daughter Aaliyah Kashyap started suffering from anxiety after getting threats on social media. Aaliyah also got rape threats after she posted pictures in lingerie. Anurag recalled that he dropped everything and ran to the US to be with his daughter. "She really is out there expressing herself but her anxiety bothers me," said Anurag.

231.title: Top win: Ian Bishop on SA's an innings and 12-run win vs England in 1st Test
231.article_body: Following South Africa's an innings and 12-run win against England in first Test at Lord's, Ian Bishop took to Twitter and wrote, "Top win for South Africa." Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "South Africa shows that Bazball doesn't work against a world class bowling attack with variety and a sharp captain who sets smart fields." South Africa lead the three-match series 1-0.

232.title: Lalu's son-in-law running govt: BJP MP on his pics at Bihar govt meetings
232.article_body: Pictures showing RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's son-in-law, Shailesh Kumar, at Bihar government's official meetings have emerged on social media. Reacting to this, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi said Lalu's son-in-law and party workers are running the government and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is "helpless". Modi said Shailesh had no business being present at the meetings.

233.title: Army defuses unexploded ordnance shell in J&K's Samba district
233.article_body: An unexploded ordnance was detected and defused by Indian Army on Friday in Jammu & Kashmir's Samba district, officials said. Personnel of the Tiger division assisted civilian administration in safely extricating the live ordnance shell from a heavily populated area, officials added. According to officials, the shell was found near Kikri Morh in Balole Nala of Samba.

234.title: Jharkhand CM lays foundation stone for 3 projects worth ₹666 cr in Ranchi
234.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren laid foundation stones for three road projects worth around ₹666 crore in Ranchi on Friday. "The state government has been working to strengthen road infrastructure and make it convenient for common people," Soren said. The road construction department claimed the state will witness road network projects worth ₹35,000 to ₹40,000 crore in two to three years.

235.title: Speculation of joining Cong is fake news: Shivpal Yadav
235.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia President Shivpal Singh Yadav has termed the speculations of him joining the Congress party as "fake news". The Uttar Pradesh MLA said that he is trying to unite the Opposition for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "When we were not considered as an alliance partner, we parted ways," Shivpal said about his party's alliance with SP.

236.title: New York Times denies BJP's claims that its Delhi schools report is 'paid news'
236.article_body: The New York Times (NYT) has responded after BJP called the US newspaper's report on Delhi schools and education system a "paid promotion". "Our report about Delhi's education system is based on impartial, on-ground reporting," said the NYT, adding, "[Our] journalism...is independent, free from political or advertiser influence." Delhi CM had earlier held a press conference over the report.

237.title: Scientists develop new simple method to destroy 'forever chemicals'
237.article_body: Scientists have developed a new method to destroy 'forever chemicals', using relatively low temperatures and common reagents, that capitalises on the 'Achilles' heel' of PFAS. They heated these chemicals in the solvent dimethyl sulfoxide and found that it "decapitated" a section of the molecule and left behind the "safest form of fluorine". PFAS causes cancer and other diseases in humans.

238.title: How does the latest World Test Championship points table read?
238.article_body: After defeating England by an innings and 12 runs at Lord's, South Africa have consolidated their position on the top of the World Test Championship points table. South Africa are placed first with 75% of points won, while England are seventh on the table with 31.37% of points won. India are placed fourth on the table, while Pakistan are fifth.

239.title: India Women announces squads for England tour, Jhulan returns for ODIs
239.article_body: India Women squads for the upcoming tour of England have been announced. Pacer Jhulan Goswami, who last played for India in March 2022, has been included in the ODI squad. Kiran Navgire, who plays for Nagaland, received her maiden call-up to India's T20I squad. India will play three T20Is beginning September 10, and three ODIs starting September 18.

240.title: Wildfire in eastern Spain is out of control: Authorities
240.article_body: Authorities in eastern Spain on Friday said a wildfire is out of control and 35 aircraft are fighting the blaze which has entered its fifth day. The fire has already scorched 19,000 hectares of forest land. Despite a bout of rainfall on Thursday, strong winds made the fire "very aggressive", the Valencia regional government said.

241.title: Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla's term extended till Aug 22, 2023
241.article_body: The central government on Friday extended for the third time the service tenure of Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla for another year, up to August 22, 2023, according to a Personnel Ministry order. Bhalla, a 1984-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer of the Assam-Meghalaya cadre, assumed the office on August 23, 2019.

242.title: Kerala is not Russia under Stalin: Cong's Satheesan to CM Vijayan
242.article_body: Kerala's Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state police's move to banish Farzeen Majeed, a Youth Congress worker, from Kannur district under the Kerala Anti-social Activities (Prevention) Act. "CM Pinarayi Vijayan should bear in mind that this is not Russia under Stalin...Of the 19 cases against [Majeed]...12 are related to...violating the Covid-19 protocol," he said.

243.title: WHO recommends 2 monoclonal antibody treatments for Ebola
243.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has recommended two existing treatments for the Ebola virus, saying they significantly reduce the number of deaths. The WHO said monoclonal antibodies Ebanga (mAb114) and Inmazeb (REGN-EB3) have "revolutionised" the treatment for the disease. The treatments are appropriate for pregnant and breastfeeding persons, old people, children and newborns, the WHO said.

244.title: H'yana appoints retired HC judge to probe killing of DSP in Nuh
244.article_body: The Haryana government on Thursday appointed a single-member inquiry commission to investigate the killing of DSP Surender Singh who was allegedly mowed down by a dumper truck during a raid against illegal mining in Nuh. The commission consists of retired Punjab and Haryana HC judge LN Mittal. The commission has been asked to submit its report within a month.

245.title: No reward bigger than this: Kartik as street vendor praises 'Bhool...'
245.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a video showing him interacting with a young street vendor. In the video, the boy could be seen telling Kartik how much he loved 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. He also did the signature step of the film before asking the actor for a selfie. "No reward bigger than this," Kartik captioned the video.

246.title: We wanted a podium finish at CWG after a bad hockey WC campaign: Salima Tete
246.article_body: Indian women's hockey team midfielder Salima Tete revealed that a podium finish was the only target that her side had at recently concluded CWG 2022 after a "bad" campaign at hockey World Cup. "Kuch na kuch karna hi hai (needed to do something)," she added. India won a bronze medal after beating New Zealand 2-1 in penalty shootout in Birmingham.

247.title: Trial courts should ensure cases are not prolonged: Supreme Court
247.article_body: The Supreme Court said the trial courts should ensure cases are not prolonged, as delays lead to problems in witness statements. The court made the observations as it granted bail to a man who is accused of helping the murderers of the Mayor of Chittor, Andhra Pradesh escape. The man was in jail for seven years but witnesses weren't examined.

248.title: Indian para javelin thrower Sumit Antil breaks his own world record
248.article_body: India's 24-year-old javelin thrower Sumit Antil on Friday broke his own world record at Indian Open National Para Athletics Championships 2022. Sumit set the new world record in F64 category with a best throw of 68.62 metres. Antil had set the previous world record (68.55 metres) at Tokyo Paralympics. He had broken world record thrice to win gold at Paralympics.

249.title: Manoj Tiwari calls for money laundering probe against Delhi Dy CM
249.article_body: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari has called for a money laundering probe against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who the CBI raided over alleged irregularities in the Delhi excise policy introduced last year. Tiwari said probe agencies should inquire whether the AAP has converted black money in Delhi and other states. The MP demanded that Sisodia should resign over the allegations.

250.title: You have same rights as me: Bangladesh PM to Hindus on Janmashtami
250.article_body: Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said Hindu people in the country have the same rights as she has. Hasina was interacting with Hindu community leaders on the occasion of Janmashtami when she made the remarks. "Please don’t undermine yourselves (Hindus). You were born in this country, you are the citizens of this country,” she said.

251.title: Hope Dobaaraa goes for Oscars: Agnihotri on Kashyap's remark on Kashmir Files
251.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri said in an interview that he hopes people go and watch Anurag Kashyap's 'Dobaaraa', and make it more successful than 'The Kashmir Files'. "Hope it (Dobaaraa) goes for the Oscars," he added. Agnihotri was reacting to Kashyap's recent remark wherein he said he hopes the former's 'The Kashmir Files' is not India's official entry for Oscars.

252.title: Lab report shared by TDP on Andhra MP's 'nude' clip not original: CID
252.article_body: Karnataka CID has refuted Telugu Desam Party's claim that a US lab has certified that Andhra Pradesh MP Gorantla Madhav's alleged nude video was genuine. CID ADG Sunil Kumar said the certificate shared by TDP leaders wasn't original. Kumar claimed a lab official said it's suspected that the video, purportedly showing a nude Madhav attending a video call, was morphed.

253.title: 10 students critically injured as lightning strikes Odisha school
253.article_body: At least 10 students of a primary school in Odisha's Deogarh district were critically injured after they were struck by lightning on Friday afternoon. Officials said 17 students were present in class when the incident took place. As per reports, the impact of the lightning left a hole in the roof, while the floor of the classroom cracked.

254.title: Police stop PDP rally against voting rights for J&K 'non-locals'
254.article_body: Leaders of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) were stopped by the police from protesting against electoral changes in Jammu and Kashmir allowing "non-locals" to vote. "Outsiders living temporarily...are being given voting rights, which is an attack on our identity and rights," said a PDP leader. The party was trying to take out a rally from Residency Road to Lal Chowk.

255.title: 14 including 5 children killed in rocket attack in northern Syria
255.article_body: At least 14 people were killed and 30 others were injured in a rocket attack on a market in northern Syria's Al-Bab on Friday, emergency responders working in the rebel-held areas informed. Five of those who lost their lives were children, rescue group White Helmets said. Al-Bab falls within the areas of Syria controlled by Turkish-backed armed opposition groups.

256.title: 11 civilians stranded on island formed in stream rescued in Himachal
256.article_body: The Army, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel and Himachal Pradesh Police's Quick Response Team on Friday rescued 11 civilians, who were stranded on an island formed in the middle of the fast-flowing Ghumarnu stream in Kangra. Earlier, the Kangra District Emergency Operations Centre had reported that the civilians were stuck due to a sudden increase in water levels.

257.title: Bee attacks Ishan Kishan during National Anthem, his reaction goes viral
257.article_body: A video went viral showing Ishan Kishan being attacked by a bee during National Anthem ahead of the first ODI against Zimbabwe. In the video, Ishan can be seen stunned after the bee attacks him. He can then be seen ducking before it flies away. "Similar things used to happen to me during prayer in school days," a fan tweeted.

258.title: Indian origin scientist joins NASA's Artemis I mission to the moon
258.article_body: Amit Pandey, who hails from Uttarakhand, is all set to join NASA's new moon programme Artemis I as a senior scientist. "NASA is currently undertaking a long-term lunar programme to enable astronauts to live and conduct research on the moon," Pandey, who works at Lockheed Martin, NASA's contractor for this mission, said in an interview with ETV Bharat.

259.title: Reuse, recycle water to become 'Aatmanirbhar': Shekhawat
259.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Friday said there is a need to reuse and recycle water in order to become "Aatmanirbhar" or self-sufficient in its supply. Speaking at the 'Har Ghar Jal Utsav' programme, Shekhawat also called for harvesting rainwater. 'Har Ghar Jal' programme will touch the lives of common people in the country, Shekhawat added.

260.title: 8 Kuki Tribal Union militants surrender in Assam's Haflong
260.article_body: At least eight militants of the Kuki Tribal Union (KTU) surrendered before security forces in Assam's Haflong on Friday, an official said. The group is mainly active in Kuki-dominated areas of Nagaland and Manipur, Dima Hasao and Karbi Anglong in Assam. It took us three months to convince them to surrender after their activities came to light, the official added.

261.title: Had night terrors after facing 'witch trial': Teacher forced to resign over bikini pics
261.article_body: The St Xavier's University, Kolkata professor, who was allegedly forced to resign over her private bikini pictures posted on Instagram, recounted her meeting with the Vice-Chancellor before she stepped down. She said it was a "witch trial" where she was "slut-shamed". "For many days after this episode, I was nauseous, unable to eat properly, visited by night terrors," she said.

262.title: Ambedkar's statue found damaged in UP's Sitapur
262.article_body: A statue of social reformer BR Ambedkar was found damaged in the Rikhipurwa village of UP's Sitapur district. The police have lodged a case against the unidentified suspects who had absconded after vandalising the statue in the early hours of Friday, police said. Notably, the district officials have assured the locals of their support in replacing the damaged statue.

263.title: Fire in sugar refinery kills 2 workers, injures 9 in Andhra Pradesh
263.article_body: Two workers were killed and nine others were injured in a fire that broke out at a sugar refinery near Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada on Friday afternoon. Police said that preliminary investigation revealed that an electrical short circuit might have triggered the fire at the conveyor belt in the unit. The injured persons were being treated in different hospitals, police added.

264.title: Bhagat enters singles, doubles finals at Thailand Para Badminton International
264.article_body: Indian shuttler Pramod Bhagat entered the finals of both men's singles and doubles at Thailand Para Badminton International 2022 tournament in Pattaya. Pramod defeated compatriot Kumar Nitesh 21-12, 21-18 in the men's singles. Bhagat along with his partner Sukant Kadam beat the Indian pair of Mohammad Arwaz Ansari and Deep Ranjan Bisoyee 21-10, 14-21, 21-14 in the men's doubles.

265.title: 14 fraud cases detected during Hisar's Agnipath recruitment drive
265.article_body: During the Agniveer recruitment rally in Haryana's Hisar, 14 aspirants were found to have allegedly used fake documents. "These cases are being caught due to strict vigilance and transparency in the recruitment process," said an official statement. The candidates allegedly used fake or tampered admit cards. The drive, under the Agnipath scheme, started on August 12.

266.title: Foreign engagement will be in line with Sharia: Taliban leader
266.article_body: Taliban's supreme spiritual leader Haibatullah Akhundzada on Thursday said that Afghanistan under Taliban will engage with the international community in accordance with Sharia law, media reports citing Afghanistan's information ministry said. "If Sharia doesn't allow it, we will not deal with any other country," he added. No country has formally recognised Taliban's rule in Afghanistan yet.

267.title: Not one asteroid but asteroid bombardment killed dinosaurs on Earth: Study
267.article_body: Not one asteroid but an asteroid bombardment on Earth might have killed dinosaurs, a new study has found. Previously, it was believed that a 10-kilometre-wide Chicxulub asteroid that struck Earth killed dinosaurs. But researchers have discovered an 8-kilometre-wide asteroid impact crater underneath North Atlantic Ocean, estimated to be 66 million years old, around the time of dinosaur extinction.

268.title: Ranbir Kapoor jokes about pregnant Alia Bhatt's weight in live video, fans react
268.article_body: During a live interaction on Thursday to promote their upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', Ranbir Kapoor joked about his pregnant wife, actress Alia Bhatt's weight gain. "Well, I can see somebody has phailoed (spread out)," he said while adding it's a joke. While some fans called it "distasteful", another fan wrote, "That was a disgusting joke to say to a pregnant woman."

269.title: You are affecting thousands of families: Vijay on 'Boycott Laal...' trend
269.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, reacting to the social media trend demanding a boycott of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said it doesn't only affect Aamir Khan but several others who are associated with the making of the film. "When Aamir sir makes a Laal Singh Chaddha...there are 2000-3000 families that are being provided for," he said, adding, "Please realise you're not affecting Aamir...alone but...economy."

270.title: 20-year-old Manisha Kalyan becomes 1st Indian to play in UEFA Women's Champions League
270.article_body: Forward Manisha Kalyan has become the first Indian footballer to play in the UEFA Women's Champions League. The 20-year-old achieved the feat by making her debut for Cypriot club Apollon Ladies against SFK Riga in the European club competition. Manisha came on as a substitute after 60 minutes in the match. Apollon Ladies FC won the match 3-0.

271.title: England's Barmy Army trolled for '1,000 days' tweet on Virat Kohli's century drought
271.article_body: England's Barmy Army today tweeted, "1,000 days," seemingly in reference to Virat Kohli not having scored an international hundred for 1,000 days. Indian fans trolled Barmy Army, with one writing, "3,532 days since England last won any format series against India in India." Another wrote, "Jason Roy + Bairstow + Buttler + Stokes = 59 international centuries...Kohli = 70 centuries."

272.title: China sentences Chinese-Canadian tycoon Xiao to 13 yrs in jail, fines his firm ₹64,500 cr
272.article_body: A Shanghai court has sentenced Chinese-Canadian billionaire Xiao Jianhua to 13 years in jail and fined his Tomorrow Holdings conglomerate 55.03 billion yuan (over ₹64,500 crore). Xiao and Tomorrow Holdings were charged with illegally siphoning away public deposits, betraying the use of entrusted property, and the illegal use of funds and bribery. Xiao hasn't been seen in public since 2017.

273.title: Geomagnetic storm creates aurora borealis in parts of US
273.article_body: As the sun is in its solar maxima, it has been erupting frequently and causing solar storms. One such geomagnetic storm that occurred on Thursday created a colourful aurora borealis that appeared in parts of the US. An aurora occurs when solar particles from the storm collide with the Earth's atmosphere. The next aurora will reportedly occur on September 23.

274.title: Nitish as Oppn's PM candidate an option if other parties want: JD(U) chief
274.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar as the Opposition's prime ministerial candidate is an option "if other parties want so", Janata Dal (United) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh said on Friday. "Nitish Kumar will work on bringing all other parties fighting the BJP on one platform to pose a united challenge to its rule," Singh added.

275.title: Centre scared as Kejriwal an alternative to PM Modi: Raghav Chadha
275.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said the Centre has "unleashed agencies such as the Central Bureau of Investigation" to "finish" party chief Arvind Kejriwal. Chadha said the BJP is "scared" of Kejriwal as he has emerged as an "alternative to PM Narendra Modi". On Friday, the agency raided Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence over alleged irregularities in Delhi's excise policy.

276.title: PETA writes to Indian Matchmaking's Sima after complaints about use of animals on show
276.article_body: PETA India wrote a letter to Sima Taparia and urged her to avoid using elephants and horses for future seasons of 'Indian Matchmaking' after receiving several complaints. It said animals are "not a good match" for wedding festivities because of the loud music, crowds and firecrackers. The letter elaborated on the atrocities animals often face when used for wedding processions.

277.title: Kejriwal govt looted Delhiites in name of liquor: BJP's Harsh Vardhan
277.article_body: Calling it the "most corrupt" government, BJP leader Harsh Vardhan accused Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP of looting people in the name of liquor in Delhi. "The corrupt, dishonest and liar Kejriwal government has no right to stay in governance," he said. "Kejriwal...has pushed the women and youth of the national capital to intoxication for his own selfish deeds," he added.

278.title: Fed up with her demand to get married, journalist kills lover in Maha; arrested
278.article_body: A 35-year-old journalist was arrested in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for allegedly killing a 24-year-old married woman with whom he was in a relationship and hacking her body into pieces. The woman had left her family and was living in a rented house. According to the police, the accused killed her as he was fed up with her demand to get married.

279.title: Bengaluru couple, their 9-year-old son found dead in apartment
279.article_body: A couple and their nine-year-old son were found dead in their apartment in Bengaluru on Thursday. The incident came to light when the family's relatives tried to contact them, but received no response, police said. Police suspect the man killed his wife and son first and later took his own life. The deceased's bodies have been sent for postmortem.

280.title: Student's suicide bid leads to fire at Hyd college; principal injured
280.article_body: A student leader threatened to set himself ablaze after pouring petrol on himself and the principal of Hyderabad's Narayana college on Friday. This resulted in an accidental fire which injured him, the principal and another college employee. The leader was arguing with the principal over the non-issuance of Transfer Certificate of a student reportedly due to unpaid fee worth ₹16,000.

281.title: Mangaluru civic body removes banner with pictures of Savarkar, Godse
281.article_body: A banner extending greetings on the occasion of the Janmashtami festival in Mangaluru's Surathkal area stirred controversy as it had pictures of Hindutva icon VD Savarkar and Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse. The banner, which was installed by a local Hindu Mahasabha leader Rajesh Pavitran, was later removed by the Mangaluru City Corporation after a complaint was received.

282.title: Open to feedback from citizens, activists: New PCMC chief
282.article_body: IIT Guwahati alumnus Shekhar Singh, who has taken charge as the new Commissioner of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC), said he will be open to feedback and suggestions from citizens and activists. Singh has earlier served as District Collector of Satara and Gadchiroli. "My focus will be on major infrastructural projects, education and health," he said.

283.title: Delhi Dy CM listed as Number 1 among 15 accused in CBI's excise scam FIR
283.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has named 15 accused, including Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, in its FIR over the Centre's allegations of corruption in the liquor policy. The agency raided at least 21 locations on Friday, including Sisodia's residence. "It is very unfortunate that those who do good work in our country are harassed like this," Sisodia tweeted.

284.title: Noida Police attach illegal assets worth ₹5.5 cr of 2 gangsters
284.article_body: Police in Gautam Buddha Nagar have attached "illegally-acquired" assets of two gangsters worth around ₹5.50 crore, officials said on Friday. The attached properties include one plot in Meerut, two in Noida and one four-wheeler and one two-wheeler. The alleged gangsters were identified as Sanjay Goyal and Sudesh Kumar.

285.title: Bhaichung Bhutia files nomination for AIFF President's post
285.article_body: Former Indian men's football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia has filed his nomination for President's post in the upcoming AIFF elections. "In the wake of the Supreme Court decision to allow players I hope players can have a chance to serve Indian football. We want to show we can be good not only as players but also as administrators," Bhutia said.

286.title: KKR CEO's conversation with Irfan after appointment of Pandit as head coach goes viral
286.article_body: KKR CEO Venky Mysore's conversation with Irfan Pathan on Twitter after appointment of Chandrakant Pandit as head coach went viral. Responding to Irfan's old tweet wherein he suggested that Pandit should get a good IPL contract, Venky wrote, "We were listening to you Irfan bhai." Irfan replied, "Haha...Venky bhai...Wishing you and Chandu bhai all the luck...Sending you my bank details."

287.title: Which 13 states have been barred from buying, selling electricity on power exchanges?
287.article_body: A total of 13 states/UTs have been barred from buying or selling electricity from spot market for not clearing pending payments of ₹5,085 crore to power generators. They are Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Madhya Pradesh, Manipur, Mizoram, Jharkhand, Bihar, J&K, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Chhattisgarh. Telangana was listed as the highest defaulter with dues worth ₹1,381 crore.

288.title: Citigroup fined $15 million by UK's financial regulator for market abuse rule failings
288.article_body: New York-headquartered Citigroup has been fined $15 million by the UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for failing to adequately monitor and report suspicious activity in financial markets for years. Citigroup's London-based trading arm didn't "properly" implement Market Abuse Regulation (MAR) trade surveillance requirements from when they were introduced in 2016 until early 2018, the FCA said.

289.title: We want to become India's electronic hub: T'gana Minister KTR
289.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Friday said the state wants to become India's electronic hub. "We are also a major player in Information Technology, hosting Microsoft's largest office outside of the US," KTR said. "The largest US FDA approved units outside of America are in Telangana which makes the state India's pharmaceutical hub," KTR further said.

290.title: Bihar CM's helicopter makes emergency landing in Gaya due to rain
290.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's helicopter on Friday made an emergency landing in Gaya due to bad weather conditions. The JD(U) chief had gone on an aerial survey of drought-hit districts including Gaya and Aurangabad on Friday morning. "The [helicopter] encountered en-route cloud on return as it was raining in Patna. We diverted it to Gaya," an airport official said.

291.title: Anurag would start 'Dobaaraa' shoot by hugging people: Vidusshi
291.article_body: Actress Vidusshi Mehra has said filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, with whom she worked in the film 'Dobaaraa', would start the shooting by hugging people. She added that at the film's premiere, Anurag hugged each member of the cast and crew, including spot boys and technicians. "It...sets a benchmark of kindness and respect that sometimes goes missing in the industry," Vidusshi said.

292.title: I'd like to see India batting first: Maninder ahead of second ODI in Harare
292.article_body: Ahead of India-Zimbabwe second ODI, Maninder Singh said he'd like to see India batting first as playing in difficult conditions will be a test in Harare. India won the toss and opted to bowl first in their 10-wicket win in first ODI on Thursday. "We saw in...later overs when the surface dried up, it became good for batting," he added.

293.title: 4 arrested for running sex racket from Gurugram spa in mall
293.article_body: Police have arrested four people, including two women, for allegedly running a sex racket from a spa in Gurugram. The spa is located in Ocus Quantum Mall in Sector 51, officials said, adding that its owner Bhagat Singh and manager Yogesh were arrested. Preliminary investigation revealed the owner pushed the women into prostitution and charged ₹2,000 per customer.

294.title: Assistant Engineer arrested while taking bribe of ₹29,000 in T'gana
294.article_body: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested an Assistant Engineer of Telangana State Southern Power Distribution Company Limited (TSSPDCL) for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹29,000 from a private contractor, an official statement said. The accused, Baisu Govinda Raju, allegedly demanded the bribe from the contractor for preparing and forwarding the bills pertaining to the works executed by him.

295.title: 'Whale vomit' worth ₹1.6 crore seized in Thane, 2 arrested
295.article_body: Two people were arrested and 0.750-gm ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹1.6 crore was seized from them in Thane's Dombivli, police said on Friday. They were intercepted after police laid a trap near a hotel on Wednesday following a tip-off, an official said. They've been charged under Wild Life (Protection) Act. Sale or possession of ambergris is prohibited in India.

296.title: Men impersonating Mumbai policemen cheat Delhi senior citizen of ₹18 lakh
296.article_body: A senior citizen in Delhi's Dwarka was allegedly cheated of ₹18 lakh by men claiming to be Mumbai Police officers. The victim claimed the accused told him to pay the money on the grounds that a woman, who had earlier made an obscene call to him, had died by suicide. He approached cyber police after realising he was being defrauded.

297.title: Jimmy Fallon & Demi Lovato dance to 'Kala Chashma', Sidharth reacts
297.article_body: 'The Tonight Show' host Jimmy Fallon and singer Demi Lovato danced to 'Kala Chashma', a video of which was shared by the singer on her Instagram handle. Sidharth Malhotra, who featured in the song with Katrina Kaif, reacted to the video on Twitter, writing, "Happy to see @jimmyfallon & @ddlovato grooving on #KalaChashma. Thank you for the love."

298.title: Auto driver arrested for killing sex worker for money in Bengaluru
298.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly killing a female sex worker near Madiwala Lake in Bengaluru last week. The auto driver, Imran (28), killed the victim, Suraya (38), and robbed her of cash and other valuables after having sex with her, police said. Notably, Suraya had hired Imran's autorickshaw for three consecutive nights starting from August 8, police added.

299.title: Woman arrested from Delhi's Majnu ka Tilla with 1.25 kg ganja
299.article_body: A 46-year-old woman was arrested from Delhi's Majnu ka Tilla area for allegedly peddling drugs, police informed on Friday. The accused, Sunita, was found in possession of 1.25 kg of ganja. Police said that she was seen making suspicious movements in Aruna Nagar on Wednesday. She was chased down by police after a brief pursuit, a police official informed.

300.title: UN peacekeeping mission pulls out of major city in Congo
300.article_body: The UN peacekeeping mission in Congo has withdrawn its personnel out of Butembo city following recent violent protests against the mission's alleged failure to protect civilians, UN and Congolese officials said on Thursday. The mission's spokeswoman, however, said "the mission has proceeded to a temporary redeployment of its personnel outside Butembo". She did not specify when they might return.

301.title: Gandhiji's statue at temple in US vandalised twice in 2 weeks, police share pic
301.article_body: A Mahatma Gandhi statue at a temple in New York's Queens was destroyed by a sledgehammer on Tuesday, in the second attack on it in two weeks. The statue outside the Shri Tulsi Mandir was reportedly smashed to pieces, defaced with obscenities and toppled over. Police shared the statue's pictures saying both incidents are being investigated as possible hate crimes.

302.title: BJP MLA Raja Singh tries to burn Munawar Faruqui's set in Hyd; stopped
302.article_body: Goshamahal BJP MLA Raja Singh, who was reportedly on his way to burn down the set at Shilpakala Vedika where standup comedian Munawar Faruqui is slated to perform on Saturday, was taken into preventive custody on Friday. Singh also told the media that his supporters have bought tickets to Faruqui's show and will try their best to stop the programme.

303.title: Unseeded Keys beats world no. 1 Swiatek to reach Cincinnati Open quarters
303.article_body: Unseeded Madison Keys defeated world number one Iga Swiatek 6-3, 6-4 to enter the quarter-final at Cincinnati Open on Thursday. "It feels great...I think I am playing some pretty good tennis," said Keys. It was Keys' first win in six matches against the top seed. The 2019 Cincinnati Open champion will face Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina in the quarter-final.

304.title: Our presence guarantees no 'Chernobyl scenario' in Zaporizhzhia: Russia
304.article_body: Russia's Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov on Friday said that the presence of Russian forces at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant guarantees that the plant does not witness a "Chernobyl scenario". On Thursday, the ministry had termed the UN proposal to demilitarise the area around the plant as "unacceptable". The plant has come under shelling several times in recent weeks.

305.title: 6 held after 83-year-old B'luru woman killed, robbed of ₹2 lakh cash
305.article_body: Six men of Nepali origin have been arrested after an 83-year-old woman was robbed and killed at her home in Bengaluru, police said. Five men were directly involved in the crime. The sixth provided information about the woman. Jewellery, gold and ₹2.4 lakh in cash were stolen from the house. The culprits include men involved in multiple robberies in Bengaluru.

306.title: Chennai woman finds worm crawling in her food; eatery faces temporary ban
306.article_body: A woman, who ordered 'Chhola Puri' at 'Namma Vidya Vasantha Bhavan' restaurant at a mall in Chennai, allegedly found a worm crawling in her food. She filed a complaint with the food safety department, following which they conducted an inspection and imposed a temporary ban on the restaurant. A warning regarding food safety measures was issued to the restaurant owner.

307.title: 'Jungle raj' prevails in Uttar Pradesh: BSP chief Mayawati
307.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Friday criticised the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh and alleged that "jungle raj" prevailed in the state. "Overall, lack of judicious use of law in Uttar Pradesh, fearlessness among criminal elements are proof of poor law and order," Mayawati tweeted. "There is extreme poverty and unemployment in all parts of UP," she added.

308.title: List shows states/UTs where women tend to have more sexual partners than men
308.article_body: Women on average have more sexual partners than men in 11 states and UTs, according to data by National Family Health Survey. These states and UTs are Rajasthan, Haryana, Chandigarh, Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Madhya Pradesh, Assam, Kerala, Lakshadweep, Puducherry and Tamil Nadu. The survey was conducted among 1.1 lakh women and 1 lakh men.

309.title: Pune Metro to finalise DPR for 82-km route by August end
309.article_body: Pune Metro rail will finalise by August-end the detailed project report (DPR) for the proposed 82.5-km route which is part of the Phase 2 works of the city's metro project. The report will be sent for approval from the state and central governments. Meanwhile, authorities are planning to make the 33-km stretch in Phase 1 operational by March next year.

310.title: Mumbai's suburban rail network to be blocked on Aug 21 for maintenance work
310.article_body: The Western Railway will enforce a 'jumbo block' of five hours on its suburban section on August 21 for maintenance work. The block will be implemented on the Down Fast line between Borivali and Goregaon and on the UP Slow line between Borivali and Kandivali stations from 10 am to 3 pm on Sunday.

311.title: BJP has chosen path of nation building: PM Modi
311.article_body: While addressing the 'Har Ghar Jal' event, PM Modi appreciated NDA's governance and said that it is easy to form a government, but his party has "chosen the path of building the nation...which takes hard work". He also criticised the Opposition and said, "People who do not care about the nation don't show any concern or interest towards...problems."

312.title: Unlikely he'll touch victim knowing she's Dalit: Court on harassment accused activist
312.article_body: The Kerala sessions court judge who had granted bail to writer-activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case had called Chandran "a reformist". Judge S Krishnakumar said Chandran was "fighting caste system" and that it was "highly unbelievable that he'll touch the body of the victim...knowing that she's a member of Scheduled Caste". Krishnakumar had called the victim's clothes 'provocative'.

313.title: Johar is a courageous man, he hired his biggest critic: Anurag
313.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap in an interview called Karan Johar a visionary and courageous man. "Today, the creative head of Dharmatic Somen Mishra was the biggest Karan Johar critic and what Karan did was hire him," he added. Anurag further said Johar is a misunderstood person. The duo worked together in the 2015 film 'Bombay Velvet'.

314.title: Putin should be banned from G20: UK PM candidate Sunak
314.article_body: Britain's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak has called on the G20 to ban Russian President Vladimir Putin from its meetings until "he stops his illegal war in Ukraine", his spokesman said on Friday. "Sitting round a table with him [Putin] isn't good enough when he is responsible for children being killed in their beds as they sleep," the spokesman added.

315.title: IRCTC shares gain 3% a day after floating tender for data monetisation
315.article_body: A day after the Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) floated a tender to monetise its data assets to bolster revenue and increase profits, its shares closed 2.94% higher on the National Stock Exchange on Friday. The Indian Railways' ticketing arm plans to generate a revenue of ₹1,000 crore. IRCTC reported a 198% increase in its Q1 net profit.

316.title: It will be remembered for a 'very long' time: Mona on 'Laal Singh...'
316.article_body: Discussing the box office failure of actor Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Mona Singh, who played Aamir's mother, said, "The movie...will be remembered for a very long time." Mona added that Aamir praised her performance after the film's editing was finished. The movie drew criticism for showing her playing Aamir's mother at 40, considering the latter is 57.

317.title: 48% pothole complaints reported from Mumbai's Western suburbs: BMC data
317.article_body: Data from Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) showed nearly 48% of total pothole-related complaints have been raised from Mumbai's western suburbs this year. This comes after a couple lost their lives in a road accident on Western Express Highway (WEH). "The WEH along with the adjoining service road is infamous for potholes...it's not BMC's responsibility to maintain them," an official said.

318.title: 4 Cong workers held for vandalising Mahatma Gandhi's photo in Rahul's Wayanad office
318.article_body: At least four Congress workers, including two staff members at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Wayanad office in Kerala, were arrested on Friday for vandalising a picture of Mahatma Gandhi, Kalpetta Police said. Congress had earlier alleged that Mahatma Gandhi's photo was damaged during the vandalism of the office allegedly by Students' Federation of India (SFI) activists on June 24.

319.title: Wanted Bihar ex-MLA on the run for over 20 years held near India-Nepal border
319.article_body: Former Bihar MLA Ranjan Tiwary, who was on the run for over 20 years, was arrested in Raxaul near India-Nepal border, police said. Tiwary was wanted by Uttar Pradesh Police for opening fire on police personnel and carried bounty of ₹25,000 on his head. "He was handed over to...UP Police for further prosecution after completion of initial formalities," police added.

320.title: New excise policy introduced to benefit liquor mafia: Delhi BJP chief
320.article_body: Reacting to the CBI raids at Manish Sisodia's residence, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta claimed that AAP introduced the new excise policy to benefit the liquor mafia. "Their sole focus was on bringing a new excise policy. They waived off ₹144 crore and gave the contracts to blacklisted companies instead of using the money for COVID relief," said Gupta.

321.title: Over 300 licences issued as Delhi to switch to old excise policy
321.article_body: Over 300 licences for retail liquor stores and 40 for wholesale stores have been issued in the national capital as Delhi prepares to switch to the old excise policy. Delhi government has also registered around 125 brands. "It's an ongoing process...in the coming weeks more licences are likely to be issued and more brands to be registered," an official said.

322.title: Coach thought I won't wake up after having 10 pegs of hard liquor, I scored a ton: Kambli
322.article_body: Former India cricketer Vinod Kambli, in a recent interview, revealed that he once had 10 pegs of hard liquor in the midst of a Ranji Trophy match and he went on to score a hundred the next day. "Our coach Balvinder Singh Sandhu was worried whether I would wake up on time. I did and scored a hundred," he said.

323.title: Will create bigger rivalry: Hogg on IPL, PSL being held alongside in 2025
323.article_body: Discussing the announcement of the men's 2023-2027 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "There's something that I love about it in 2025. That's the PSL being forced to take place alongside...IPL." "This...[will] create a bigger rivalry between the...countries," added Hogg. "Fans are going to get behind their T20 competition to outdo their rivals," he stated.

324.title: Plea in Patna HC seeks removal of Nitish Kumar as Bihar CM
324.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation has been filed in Patna High Court seeking the removal of Nitish Kumar as the Chief Minister of Bihar after he formed the Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar. The plea states that voters had given a mandate to NDA, not to the Grand Alliance government. Petitioner Dharamsheela Devi said Kumar's act has damaged the parliamentary democracy system.

325.title: CBI raid an attempt to stop revolutionary work by Delhi govt: AAP leader
325.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh said the CBI raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence was an attempt to stop "revolutionary work" done by AAP government in education and health sector. He claimed that the raids weren't regarding the liquor case. "Otherwise, there should've been raids in Gujarat...where numerous people lost their lives after consumption of spurious liquor," Sanjay added.

326.title: Youth gets life term for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyderabad
326.article_body: A POCSO court in Hyderabad on Thursday sentenced a 19-year-old youth to life imprisonment for sexually assaulting a minor girl in 2019. The court also imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him. As per the complaint, the accused lured the minor girl and took her to Cheryala village, where he sexually assaulted her by making false promises.

327.title: Xi & Putin to attend G20 summit in Bali: Indonesian Prez Widodo
327.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will attend the G20 summit in Bali in November this year, Indonesian President Joko Widodo told Bloomberg News in an interview. This update comes amid West's heightened tensions with Russia and China over Ukraine and Taiwan. The trip would also be Xi's first visit outside China since January 2020.

328.title: CDPQ likely to buy Vodafone's residual stake in Indus Towers: Report
328.article_body: Canadian pension fund Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec (CDPQ) is likely to acquire Vodafone's residual stake in Indus Towers, according to a media report. The report mentioned that due diligence is expected to begin soon. Vodafone's 21% stake in Indus Towers is valued at around ₹11,270 crore, based on the latter's ₹53,669.67 crore market capitalisation on Thursday.

329.title: Important for us to tell the story: Diljit on his film on 1984 anti-Sikh riots
329.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has confirmed his next film 'Jogi', which is set in the time of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Diljit, who was born in 1984, said he has grown up hearing stories about the riots, adding that the subject is really important for him. "It's very important for us to tell the story of the incident to...people," Diljit said.

330.title: I'd marry Messi at 'any moment', jokes ex-Argentina player Gorosito
330.article_body: Former Argentina footballer Pipo Gorosito jokingly stated that he would marry Lionel Messi at "any moment". "I feel so much admiration. For me, he is the ideal...friend," added Gorosito. Talking about Messi not being nominated for the Ballon d'Or for the first time since 2005, Gorosito stated, "There are interests that play in the nominations. It is very difficult."

331.title: I can't say if I'll be selected or not: India pacer Chahar on T20 WC spot
331.article_body: Speaking about his chances of securing a spot in India's squad for T20 World Cup following his bowling performance in the team's 10-wicket win against Zimbabwe in first ODI, India pacer Deepak Chahar stated, "I can't say if I'll be selected or not." Chahar, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', posted bowling figures of 7-0-27-3 in Harare on Thursday.

332.title: Govt agencies are part of BJP's Mahagathbandhan: SP leader
332.article_body: SP leader Sunil Singh Yadav condemned the CBI crackdown on Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in excise policy case. He accused probe agencies of working at behest of the BJP. "All government agencies...have become a part of BJP 'Mahagathbandhan' now, but the government should not forget the consequences any dictator faces; this government will also face the same," Yadav said.

333.title: People will beat him with shoes: BJP leader on Saugata Roy's shoes remark
333.article_body: BJP's national Vice President Dilip Ghosh said people will beat senior Trinamool Congress leader Saugata Roy with shoes. Ghosh's comment came after Roy said "shoes will be made by peeling off skin of those who believe they can get away by maligning the party". "TMC leaders will be beaten up with shoes in various parts of state," Ghosh added.

334.title: Interfaith couple found dead in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, probe underway
334.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was found dead in her boyfriend's relative's house in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district on Thursday, police said, adding that the boy was allegedly lying unconscious close to her body and later died. According to police, both belonged to different communities and were in a relationship. The autopsy report revealed that they died after consuming poison, police added.

335.title: Rana, 7-year-old sniffer dog of Mumbai Police bomb squad, dies
335.article_body: Rana, a seven year-old dog serving with the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) of the Mumbai Police, died on Wednesday, an officer said. The Labrador, who was trained as a sniffer dog, was undergoing treatment due to stomach-related ailments. Rana was given the proper police guard of honour reserved for the death of police personnel, the official added.

336.title: Sensex falls 651.85 points, Nifty ends below 17,800
336.article_body: The benchmark indices closed in the red on Friday with Sensex falling 651.85 points to 59,646.15. Nifty was down 198 points at 17,758.50. IndusInd Bank, Apollo Hospitals, Bajaj Finserv, Tata Motors and Hindalco Industries were among the major Nifty losers, while Adani Ports, L&T, Infosys, Eicher Motors and Bajaj Auto stocks gained. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices dropped 1% each.

337.title: Everyone in theatre screamed 'Jai Mahishmati': Ananya on watching Baahubali
337.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday said she went to watch SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' a day before her exam, along with father and actor Chunky Panday. "Everyone in the theatre screamed 'Jai Mahishmati' before the film started. They were screaming and crying together," added Ananya. Actress Ramya Krishnan, who starred in the film, said she's still in awe of the movie.

338.title: NEP envisioned increase in youth's employability: Education Minister
338.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan claimed that the aim of National Education Policy is to increase youth's employability. "The benefits of this scheme will be seen in a few years and then it will become successful. NEP has envisioned the increase in employability of nation's youth by training students in schools and giving importance to Indian languages," Pradhan said.

339.title: Delhi Police busts fake call centre cheating job seekers
339.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday raided a fake call centre near Subhash Nagar metro station that would allegedly cheat people of thousands of rupees on the pretext of training them for data scientist jobs. After a fake technical test and interview, job seekers would be declared failed and a fee to "train" them for the role would be sought, police said.

340.title: Earthquake of 3.6 magnitude hits Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh
340.article_body: Mild tremors were felt in the Pithoragarh area of Uttarakhand on Friday after an earthquake of 3.6 magnitude on the Richter scale hit the region. According to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS), the earthquake occurred around 12:55 pm. Earlier during the day, another earthquake of magnitude 3.1 on the Richter scale occurred near Jammu and Kashmir's Hanley village.

341.title: Vijay Deverakonda criticised for putting his feet up on table in front of journalist, responds
341.article_body: During a media interaction, Vijay Deverakonda put up his feet on the table while speaking with a journalist. The journalist told Vijay he wasn't able to talk freely with him, following which Vijay made an attempt to comfort him. After this led to reports about his attitude problem, Vijay tweeted, "Anybody trying to grow in their field will...have...target on...back."

342.title: Mumbai Police book principal for being racist towards tribal students
342.article_body: Seven tribal students of a teachers' training institute at Fort, Mumbai have accused their principal, Urmila Paralikar, of being "racist" and "vulgar". The Azad Maidan Police have booked Paralikar under the SC-ST Act, 1989 and Section 509 of the IPC. The complainants alleged that Paralikar commented on the private parts of the female students and mocked their tribal accents.

343.title: Paraguay VP backtracks, says he won't resign after corruption claims
343.article_body: Paraguayan Vice President Hugo Velazquez said that he was withdrawing his resignation, backtracking on a vow he made last week shortly after the US sanctioned him for "significant corruption". Velazquez told reporters he'd initially offered to resign as he "assumed" there was a domestic investigation against him. Velazquez said there's no investigation against him in Paraguay or in the US.

344.title: BJP has 2 hands, CBI & ED: TMC MP Roy after CBI raids on Sisodia
344.article_body: Following CBI raids on Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence, TMC MP Saugata Roy said, "BJP has two hands, CBI and ED. They did the same in Bengal and Maharashtra." Similar raids were carried out on Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain also, he added. "This is a tactic to suppress...Opposition. Nothing has been found in the raids," he further said.

345.title: Cactus Venture Partners closes debut fund with ₹350 crore
345.article_body: Cactus Venture Partners (CVP) announced raising ₹350 crore in the initial close of its debut fund. The early-stage venture capital fund will now expect to raise ₹750 crore by December 2022, the company said.
