It also plans to primarily invest the amount in clean-tech, health-tech and B2B SaaS companies in India. General Partners have also committed 15% to the fund.

346.title: Girl sitting with male friend stripped & thrashed in UP; 5 arrested
346.article_body: A girl sitting at a secluded spot with a male friend of hers was allegedly stripped and beaten with a belt in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur by six persons. Five of the accused persons have been arrested after a video of the incident went viral online. The accused also reportedly abused the duo and thrashed the girl's friend.

347.title: Ola told to pay ₹95,000 to customer who was charged ₹800 despite incomplete trip in Hyd
347.article_body: Ola Cabs has been told to pay ₹88,000 in compensation and ₹7,000 in legal fees for a man charged ₹861 despite 'poor service' and an incomplete trip in Hyderabad. The customer Jabez Samuel alleged he found the cab he boarded in October 2021 'untidy'. He also alleged that the driver behaved rudely and dropped him off without completing the trip.

348.title: MP ASI seeks spiritual guru's 'guidance' to solve murder case; suspended
348.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur was suspended after he allegedly sought the guidance of a self-styled 'spiritual guru' to solve a 17-year-old girl's murder case. In a video that surfaced online, the 'spiritual guru' purportedly said he has called out a few names and the one name that he missed is a clue about the accused's identity.

349.title: GHMC to get 24 fabricated ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols in Hyd
349.article_body: Ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is planning to procure 24 portable prefabricated fibre-reinforced plastic ponds for idol immersion in Hyderabad. It's also planning to create 22 temporary excavated ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols. This comes after the Supreme Court's order to not allow immersion of idols made of Plaster of Paris in Hussain Sagar.

350.title: Google Search working on updates to make clickbait content less visible
350.article_body: Google announced it is working on updates to improve its search results as "people don't find content helpful if it seems like it was designed to attract clicks rather than inform readers". The updates will ensure that poor-quality content does not rank high in Google's Search results, it said. Starting next week, updates will roll out for English users globally.

351.title: DIIs have sold shares worth ₹4,283 crore in August so far: NSE
351.article_body: Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) have sold around ₹4,283 crore in Indian shares since the beginning of August, National Stock Exchange (NSE) showed. DIIs have also bought a net of more than ₹3.67 trillion between March 2021 and July 2022. DIIs have bought shares worth nearly ₹2.37 trillion so far this year, absorbing the foreign institutional investors' (FIIs) selling pressure.

352.title: Secunderabad man cheated of ₹40 lakh in cryptocurrency fraud
352.article_body: A resident of Secunderabad was allegedly cheated of ₹40 lakh on the pretext of investing in cryptocurrency by a fraudster he befriended on Facebook. The accused claimed to be a businessman dealing in cryptocurrency in Hong Kong. "On the pretext of making systematic investments to get good profits, the fraudster collected...password and login id...and duped him," Cyber crime officials said.

353.title: Declare lumpy skin disease in cows as pandemic: Raj CM to Centre
353.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday demanded that the central government should declare the lumpy skin disease in cows as pandemic and give assistance to the state to handle the situation. "The way cows succumb to this disease is painful and unimaginable," Gehlot said. Over 22,000 animals, mainly cows, have died due to the disease in Rajasthan.

354.title: 'Fitoor': Vicky Kaushal on the Katrina Kaif film which he 'hates'
354.article_body: Talking about the film starring his wife and actress Katrina Kaif which he "hates", during an appearance on 'Koffee with Karan 7' alongside actor Sidharth Malhotra, actor Vicky Kaushal named "Fitoor". Talking about the failure of 'Fitoor', Katrina had earlier said, "My priorities were...different at that point in time...If a person takes things for granted...the film will obviously suffer."

355.title: Top seed Medvedev enters 2nd Masters 1000 quarters of 2022 at Cincinnati Open
355.article_body: World number one and top seed Daniil Medvedev defeated Canadian Denis Shapovalov 7-5, 7-5 to reach his second ATP Masters 1000 quarter-final of the season at Cincinnati Open on Thursday. "In general, happy with my level," said Medvedev. The 26-year-old Russian will now face American Taylor Fritz, who beat sixth-seeded Andrey Rublev 6-7(4-7), 6-2, 7-5 in the round of 16.

356.title: Gold falls to 3-week low, heads for weekly drop amid strong dollar
356.article_body: Gold prices dropped to a three-week low on Friday in the international markets amid chances of more rate hikes by the US Federal Reserve and a stronger dollar. The prices were also heading for their first weekly decline in five weeks. On the Multi-Commodity Exchange, gold contracts were trading 0.3% lower at ₹51,451 per 10 gram.

357.title: Hate my 'Darlings' character to the core, will never revisit the film: Vijay
357.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who played the role of an abusive husband Hamza in his latest film 'Darlings', has said that he hates the character "to the core". He said that he is "done" watching the film, adding he is never going to revisit it. "It is a difficult experience watching yourself be this man you hate," Vijay further said.

358.title: IMD predicts intense rainfall over east-central India
358.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted intense rainfall during the next three-four days across east-central India due to development of a depression over north Bay of Bengal. The depression is likely to cross West Bengal and Odisha coast between Balasore & Sagar Island today evening. "We are expecting heavy rain over Odisha on August 19 and 20," said DG, IMD.

359.title: US to give 8 attack & utility helicopters to Czech Republic for free
359.article_body: The US will give Czech Republic eight Bell military helicopters for free, US embassy in Prague said. The move comes in response to Prague's "clear and unwavering stance" on Russia-Ukraine war, Czech Defence Minister said. "Not only have we gained the respect of our allies...[by] helping Ukraine, but we've also gained their support in modernising our army," Jana Cernochova added.

360.title: Late, but welcome: Congress on CBI raid at Delhi Dy CM Sisodia’s house
360.article_body: Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee head Anil Kumar hailed the CBI search at Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday, calling the raids "late, but welcome". "The Congress party has been continuously demanding this raid," Kumar said. "You haven't got a licence for corruption by putting forward your education and health model," he added.

361.title: Gandhi said alcohol destroys both body and soul: Gambhir after CBI raids
361.article_body: Following CBI raids at 21 locations in connection with the excise policy case, including the residence of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, cricketer-turned-BJP leader Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter to say "Delhi deserves better". "Mahatma Gandhi had said alcohol destroys both body and soul," his tweet read. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had "welcomed" the CBI earlier today.

362.title: Salman's ex-girlfriend Somy calls him a 'woman beater', says 'he's a sadistic sick *#uk'
362.article_body: Former Bollywood actress Somy Ali has shared an old poster of Salman Khan-starrer 'Maine Pyar Kiya' on Instagram and wrote, "A women beater, and not just me, but many." "Stop worshipping him please. He's a sadistic sick *#uk. You have no idea," she added. In a post in March, Somy had claimed that 'Harvey Weinstein of Bollywood' will be exposed.

363.title: Kejriwal shares NYT story on Delhi schools amid raids on Delhi Education Minister
363.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal shared a picture of a New York Times (NYT) front page that featured a story on Delhi's schools, amid CBI raids on Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia. Calling Sisodia "the best education minister of independent India", Kejriwal said, "CBI is welcome. We will cooperate fully." He said the agency "won't find anything" in the raids.

364.title: Wanted to join Army, but couldn't due to my family situations: Rajnath
364.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday revealed that he'd also wanted to join the Army and gave Short Service Commission examination. However, he said that due to certain situations in his family, including his father's death, he was unable to do so. Moreover, he said, "If you give...Army uniform to a kid, his personality changes. There is...charisma in this uniform."

365.title: Case filed against B'luru college for holding I-Day event without permission
365.article_body: A case has been registered against Mount Carmel College (MCC) in Bengaluru for organising a cultural event on Independence Day without permission. According to an inquiry, the college management had forced the students to sell tickets to the event. As a result, nearly 8,000 people were on the street which led to inconvenience to the general public, police said.

366.title: He is not brain dead, injections caused swelling in brain nerves: Raju's manager
366.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava's manager has denied reports that he is brain dead. "There is nothing like this. He is unconscious. There was swelling in his brain nerves," he stated. "With some medicines, he was unable to respond. Then some injections were given which caused swelling in some of his brain nerves. Doctors are treating it," the manager added.

367.title: 10 crore rural households connected to clean piped water facility: PM
367.article_body: Speaking at 'Har Ghar Jal Utsav' in Goa, PM Narendra Modi said that 10 crore rural households of India are now connected to the facility of clean water through pipes. "In the seven decades since the Independence...three crore rural households had piped water," PM added. Goa has become the first state to be certified with 'Har Ghar Jal', PM stated.

368.title: Pilots fall asleep while flying Ethiopian Airlines plane at 37,000 feet, miss landing
368.article_body: Two Ethiopian Airlines pilots fell asleep while flying a plane from Sudan to Ethiopia and missed their landing on Monday. The plane's autopilot system kept the plane cruising at 37,000 feet. When the plane overflew the runway where it was supposed to land, the autopilot disconnected. That triggered an alarm, which woke up the pilots, according to Aviation Herald.

369.title: Anurag Thakur is a 'goli maaro chhap' minister: AAP leader after CBI raids
369.article_body: After Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur's remarks following CBI raids at the residence of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, Aam Aadmi Party leader Sanjay Singh called him a "goli maaro chhap" minister. "It is unfortunate that Anurag Thakur is a minister of the country who had said goli maaro...I don't take his comments seriously," Sanjay Singh said.

370.title: TV actress Nupur quits industry, says 'my husband has freed me, I'm going to Himalayas'
370.article_body: TV actress Nupur Alankar has quit the industry, stating that she took 'sanyaas' in February. Adding that she's leaving Mumbai and moving to Himalayas, Nupur said her husband Alankar Srivastava has freed her to follow the spiritual path. "When I was a part of showbiz, I worried about popularity and success. Today, I am at peace," she said.

371.title: Not 1st case of corruption by AAP: Thakur as CBI raids Sisodia
371.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised AAP as the CBI conducted raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence and other locations in connection with the Delhi liquor policy case. "No matter how hard a corrupt person tries to prove himself innocent, he will still remain corrupt. This is not the first case of corruption by AAP," Thakur said.

372.title: Rajasthan govt to give smartphones to 1.35 crore women in the state
372.article_body: Rajasthan government has decided to give smartphones to 1.35 crore women in the state as part of the Chief Minister Digital Seva Yojana. As many as three major Indian telecom companies have shown interest, officials said on Friday. Women heads of 1.35 crore families under the Chiranjeevi Health Insurance Scheme will be given smartphones with internet connectivity for three years.

373.title: Misuse of investigative agencies help corrupt get away: Congress
373.article_body: The Congress on Friday said the "relentless misuse" of investigative agencies against political rivals erodes their credibility. "In the process, the corrupt get away hiding behind the 'misuse' argument and the honest end up paying the price," party spokesperson Pawan Khera tweeted. This comes after CBI raided residence of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia over the Delhi excise policy case.

374.title: Thailand saw 3.78 million tourists from Jan to mid-Aug: Govt
374.article_body: Thailand saw 3.78 million tourist arrivals from January to August 17 this year, Taweesin Visanuyothin, a government spokesperson, said. The arrivals generated revenues of 176 billion baht ($4.93 billion), he added. Visanuyothin also said that Thailand will extend the duration of its visa-on-arrival, which applies to Indian, Chinese and Saudi Arabian nationals, from 15 days to 30 days from October.

375.title: 4-storey building collapses in Mumbai's Borivali West; video surfaces
375.article_body: A four-storey building collapsed in Saibaba Nagar of Borivali West in Mumbai on Friday, Fire brigade officials said. A video of the building collapsing has surfaced online. At least eight fire engines and fire brigade personnel rushed to the spot, BMC said. Earlier this month, a portion of a five-storey residential building in Thane city's Daighar area collapsed.

376.title: He wanted to 'protect' himself: Sivaramakrishnan on Kuldeep's 0/36
376.article_body: Discussing Kuldeep Yadav's spell in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, where he conceded 36 runs without picking a wicket, ex-India leg-spinner Laxman Sivaramakrishnan said Kuldeep wanted to "protect" himself. "MS Dhoni would advice Kuldeep...on what to bowl...But today, the situation was different," added Sivaramakrishnan. "Kuldeep was making a comeback...He wanted to play all...games," he stated.

377.title: Parts of Gurugram to get no water for 24 hrs on Aug 22, list of areas shared
377.article_body: Water supply will be affected in parts of Gurugram for 24 hours from August 22 to August 23 because of master water supply pipeline from the Basai water treatment plant being shut due to construction work. Supply will be affected in sectors 4, 5, 9, 12, 14, 17, 18, 21, 22, Palam Vihar and Dayanand colony, a notice said.

378.title: Ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya applies for US Green Card: Reports
378.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who recently fled the country, has applied for a US Green Card, reports said. His lawyers have started the procedure to obtain the Green Card, stating Rajapaksa's wife Loma being a US citizen as the factor which makes him eligible for it, reports added. Rajapaksa in 2019 renounced his US citizenship to contest Presidential elections.

379.title: Mother, lover beat minor son, burn him with hot sieve in Gurugram
379.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested for allegedly beating her 13-year-old son and burning his face and feet with a hot sieve after he saw them in an objectionable position in Gurugram, police said on Thursday. The woman's lover also apparently threatened to chop the boy's legs when the latter threatened to complain. The boy, however, managed to escape.

380.title: Traffic diversions to be in place today in Pune for Dahi Handi
380.article_body: The Pune City Traffic Police has announced that traffic diversions will be in place in parts of the city from 5 pm today as festivities for Dahi Handi are expected to attract large crowds. The traffic police said that the diversions will be in place until the 'handis' or earthen pots are broken and the roads are cleared for traffic.

381.title: Govt shares map, says 'IITs reaching students in every corner of India'
381.article_body: The Centre has shared a picture of the map of India, showing the presence of IITs in as many as 21 states and two union territories. "Indian Institute of Technology (IITs) reaching students in every corner of India," the Centre tweeted. It also stated that eight of the IITs were established in the last decade.

382.title: 15 prisoners get death sentence for killing inmate in Jharkhand
382.article_body: A court in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district has handed death sentence to 15 prisoners for killing a fellow inmate at the Ghaghidih Central Jail in 2019. Seven others have been sentenced to 10 years in jail. The killing occurred following a clash between two factions of prisoners over breaking a queue at the jail's telephone booth.

383.title: Be careful while signing official documents: Mamata to WB ministers
383.article_body: While addressing a meeting, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday told all of the state ministers to be "very careful" while signing official documents, a senior official said. This comes after the arrests of former state minister Partha Chatterjee and TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in separate alleged scams. "You (ministers) should all maintain a simple life," Banerjee said.

384.title: Pune reports rise in swine flu cases; vaccines distributed to hospitals
384.article_body: Pune city has been witnessing a rise in swine flu cases with 435 positive cases and 20 deaths till August 16. Vaccine stock has been supplied to hospitals to ensure that high-risk patients don't face inconvenience, Health department officials said. As many as 3,785 samples were sent for testing this year and 435 patients tested positive, Pune Municipal Corporation added.

385.title: Arvind Kejriwal issues missed call number for 'Make India No. 1' mission
385.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Friday launched a missed called number as part of the 'Make India No. 1' mission. "I am issuing a number today, missed call number 9510001000. Those who want to join this mission, those who want to see India as...the most powerful nation...should join this mission," Kejriwal said.

386.title: Two wickets down, one to go: Mishra after CBI raids Sisodia's residence
386.article_body: After CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday morning, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said "two wickets had fallen and the third will soon". "I've been saying...Satyendar Jain, Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal will all go to jail for corruption," Mishra tweeted. Earlier in May, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested in an alleged money laundering case.

387.title: Pune woman leaves home to end life, police check hotels; locate, rescue her
387.article_body: The Pune city police located a woman who had allegedly left her house with an intention of ending her life. She was located after police checked several hotels and lodges in the city. The woman is a doctor and her husband had filed a missing complaint after she had left home. Reports said that she was reunited with her family.

388.title: J&K Waqf Board bans trustees from collecting donations at shrines
388.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Waqf Board has banned trustees from collecting donations at shrines and mosques, calling it an "unethical practice". The decision on the ban was taken following complaints "against some people receiving donations forcibly and through exploitative means", according to the Board. The Board said that such acts of "pilferage" are "severely limiting" its ability to perform charity.

389.title: India's CWG lawn bowls champs break down, say 'People said we were selected due to looks'
389.article_body: The members of India's women's fours lawn bowls team, that won historic gold at CWG 2022, broke down during an interview recalling the criticism they faced in the build up to the Games. Lovely Choubey stated people told them that they were selected due to their looks. "Criticism that we faced cannot be expressed in words," said Rupa Rani Tirkey.

390.title: 21-yr-old woman gets 3 men to gang-rape 11-yr-old friend, watches it in Mumbai
390.article_body: An 11-year-old girl was gang-raped by three men in Mumbai's Virar. The girl had gone for a walk with a 21-year-old female friend, whom she met at a mobile repair shop. The female friend took the victim to an isolated spot and called three of her male friends. The victim's friend then watched the sexual assault.

391.title: 3 arrested for rhino horn smuggling in Assam
391.article_body: Three people have been arrested by the forest officials in Assam for their involvement in the smuggling of rhino horns near Kaziranga National Park. "One of the accused was caught from the Baghmari area. After his confession, two others were also nabbed," said District Forest Officer. Park officials found the dehorned rhino on May 9.

392.title: Video of KL Rahul removing chewing gum before National Anthem goes viral, fans react
392.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain KL Rahul removing chewing gum from his mouth ahead of the National Anthem before the start of the first ODI against Zimbabwe. "Proud of you," a fan wrote. "He is truly a gentleman," wrote another. Earlier, Virat Kohli was criticised for chewing gum during National Anthem in 2017 and January 2022.

393.title: PM Modi extends greetings to citizens on Janmashtami
393.article_body: On the occasion of Janmashtami, PM Modi greeted citizens and wished for everyone's prosperity. "Hearty greetings to all the countrymen on the auspicious occasion of Janmashtami. May this festival of devotion and gaiety bring happiness, prosperity and good fortune to everyone's life. Long live Shri Krishna!" tweeted PM. President Droupadi Murmu also extended greetings on the auspicious day.

394.title: Eatery owner stabs customer after dispute over biryani bill in UP
394.article_body: An eatery owner allegedly stabbed a customer following a dispute over biryani bill in Uttar Pradesh's Jalaun. According to police, the victim paid ₹50 to the owner for biryani but the latter denied having received the payment and demanded money again. This led to a brawl. The customer was hospitalised after getting stabbed multiple times, while the accused is absconding.

395.title: 2022 deadliest year on record for Mexican journalists: Report
395.article_body: Article 19, a human rights organisation, said in a report that 2022 has been the deadliest year on record for journalists in Mexico, with 18 murders. Nine of those deaths have showcased a potential link to the journalist's work, the organisation's regional director Leopoldo Maldonado said. Maldonado added, "2022 could be the worst year in a century for the press."

396.title: Domino's India parent stock gained 14% so far in Aug after Q1 results
396.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, parent company of Domino's Pizza India, fell over 3% on BSE at 11:50 am on Friday. However, it gained over 14% so far this month while witnessing an upward trend. The company reported a strong Q1 earnings with a 63% growth in consolidated profit at ₹112.6 crore and its consolidated revenue from operations was up by 40.5%.

397.title: Country's confidence and trust in BJP has grown: Rajnath Singh
397.article_body: Talking about BJP's pro-people ideology, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh claimed that country's confidence and trust in the party has grown. "The perception of the people about the BJP has changed. There has been a sense of trust and confidence across India towards the BJP. India's reputation has risen on the international level," said Singh.

398.title: Oil prices fall amid global economic slowdown concerns
398.article_body: After two days of gain, oil prices fell on Friday amid concerns about a global economic slowdown. Brent crude futures fell 36 cents to $96.23 a barrel, while the US West Texas Intermediate crude was at $90.29 a barrel, falling 21 cents. US crude oil inventories declined as US exported 5 million barrels per day in the most recent week.

399.title: What is the wait time for US visa appointment in different Indian cities?
399.article_body: The US has listed that people applying for visitor visa in Delhi will have to wait 582 days for an appointment while the wait time for student visa is 471 days. The wait time for visitor visa in Mumbai is 580 days. The waiting period for visitor visa in Kolkata, Hyderabad and Chennai is 587, 510 and 513 days, respectively.

400.title: Windfall profit tax on diesel export hiked, domestic crude tax cut
400.article_body: The government on Thursday increased the windfall profit tax on the export of diesel to ₹7 per litre from ₹5 per litre, Finance Ministry notification showed. It also brought back a ₹2 a litre tax on the export of aviation turbine fuel. The tax on domestically produced crude oil has been slashed from ₹17,750 per tonne to ₹13,000 per tonne.

401.title: It's Raj's misfortune that it doesn't have a full-time Home Minister: BJP
401.article_body: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia on Thursday said it is the state's misfortune that it doesn't have a full-time Home Minister for the last three-and-a-half years. He alleged that Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot, who also handles the home department, doesn't seem concerned about public safety. "For him, the security of his chair is bigger than people's security," Poonia added.
